jobTitle: Process Development Engineer I, Gene Therapy Purification Development (1 of 2)
jobDescription: Regeneron’s Viral Production Core is looking for a Process Development Engineer focusing on gene therapy purification process development. This individual will work as part of a multi-functional team to generate Adeno-Associated Virus (AAV) manufacturing processes and products with the aim of providing treatment to unmet medical needs through gene therapy. This is a growth opportunity that combines the excitement and opportunity of a start-up with the security and institutional knowledge gained from working for an established biopharmaceutical company. The ideal candidate will be hardworking, efficient, flexible, scientifically curious, enthusiastic, and proactively learn or seek clarification while being able to perform key responsibilities in a fast-paced, team environment. A Typical Day In The Role Might Look Like Support downstream viral vector process development and production through design, characterization, and implementation of robust purification processes suitable for future GMP clinical production. Optimize parameters for purification of AAV-derived viral vectors using multivariate design of experiment approaches and write development reports for characterized unit operations. Document experiments, results, and findings in electronic laboratory notebook and LIMS; present work at group and department meetings. Maintain equipment and solve instrumental/experimental problems. Reads and understands scientific literature and user documentation and implements experimental plans to verify literature findings. Develop expertise in theory and practice of manufacturing steps and analytical methods. Cross-train on and provide support for analytical and upstream operations. Support weekend or off-hour experimental and pilot scale work, as required. This Role Might Be For You If You have strong initiative to complete challenging tasks and learn new technologies. You are capable of multi-tasking, thinking critically, working both independently and within a team environment. Have excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills. This position requires a Bachelor’s degree in either Chemical Engineering, Biochemical Engineering, Biochemistry, or related field with 3-5 years meaningful experience, or Master’s Degree with 0-3 experience. A strong fundamental understanding of the principles of purification process development and a history of developing downstream steps within bioprocesses is a plus. Experience preferred with some of the following systems : Depth filtration, Tangential flow filtration, Affinity Capture chromatography, Polishing chromatography. Prior experience with producing AAV-based gene therapies is a plus. This job will periodically require short duration physical exertions, including light-medium lifting. Does this sound like you? jobTitle: Process Development Engineer II - Pilot Scale Purification
jobDescription: Regeneron's Preclinical Manufacturing & Process Development Group (PMPD) is seeking a Process Development Engineer II as a full time position to work in the Purification Development group. In this role, you will be responsible for the purification at pilot scale of a variety of clinical biologics, building systems to support the planning and execution of pilot scale work, investigating technologies to support the scalability of pilot scale operations, and managing other engineers focused on pilot scale operations. The ideal candidate will be hardworking, efficient, flexible, and able to perform key responsibilities in a fast-paced, team environment. This is a lab based role focused on pilot scale operations, requiring a significant amount of physical activity. A Typical Day In The Role Might Look Like An engineer who is experienced in the general operations of a laboratory and/or functional area. Manages and organizes data independently - has some decision making capability and works with supervisor to make well informed decisions. Participates effectively as a member of a "team" within their laboratory or functional area. Communicates with all levels of the organization. Complete experiments alone and/or in collaboration with others. Performs routine technical tasks, and manages, organizes, and interprets data independently, and presents results to their supervisor. Receives general instruction for routine work; more detailed instruction is provided for new projects. The ability to design experiments with proper controls. Performs experiments/projects using established procedures. Performs basic data entry and analysis alone or in collaboration with others and recognizes unexpected results. Understands scientific method and experimental controls and works to perfect technique on the basics. Scientifically curious, enthusiastic, and proactively asks questions to learn or seek clarification Provides coaching, mentorship, and performance planning to direct reports and/or junior team members. Reads and understands scientific literature and technical documentation. Implements experimental plans to verify literature findings with direction and prepares comparison of internal data to literature for review with manager. Trains and becomes proficient in operations of job-relevant laboratory instrumentation and data systems. May have a role in knowledge/data management and be responsible for maintenance and service of lab/data resources. Will assist in training new staff after demonstrating competency. Will support technology development and improvement initiatives May contribute to development of technology and automation to increase the throughput and speed of pilot scale operations. Builds relationships within subgroup and department to support the shared goals of training and mentoring direct reports and co-op students/interns. Proactively assists others in execution of experiments and knows when to ask for help from peers. This Role Might Be For You If You Enjoy a fast paced pilot scale laboratory setting where sound science and team work are the priorities. Contribute to lab equipment maintenance and safety to help create a safe, effective and efficient working environment. Anticipate and recognize potential problems with laboratory supplies / equipment and act to prevent and tackle problems. Can ensure training and/or compliance responsibilities are maintained. The role requires A Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree in either Chemical Engineering, Biochemical Engineering, or Biochemistry, and 3 - 5+ years’ experience in the biotech or pharmaceutical industry. A strong fundamental understanding of various protein purification techniques is a plus. Experience with Downstream Development and with equipment like: Tangential flow filters, Normal flow filters, ultrafiltration/diafiltration skids, Akta chromatography systems, disc stack centrifuge, depth filtration, chromatographic columns, HPLC, UPLC, Empower, Unicorn, JMP, LIMS, PI Historian is a plus. Experience with raman spectroscopy and/or software programming is a plus. Does this sound like you? Apply now to take your first steps toward living the Regeneron Way! jobTitle: Process Development Engineer II, Purification Development
jobDescription: Regeneron's Preclinical Manufacturing & Process Development Group (PMPD) is seeking a Process Development Engineer II as a full time position to work in the Purification Development group. In this role, you will be responsible for the purification of various pre-clinical biological molecules to provide reagents for Regeneron’s research and discovery groups as well as managing other engineers focused on reagent purifications. This is a lab-based role that requires real-time data interpretation and problem-solving. The ideal candidate will be hardworking, efficient, flexible, and able to perform key responsibilities in a fast-paced, team environment. A Typical Day In The Role Might Look Like Purification of a diverse array of proteins to support any of Regeneron’s research and discovery groups, following established procedures when available, but recognizing unexpected results or improvement opportunities and modifying strategies appropriately. Development of technology and automation to increase process throughput and efficiency of preclinical manufacturing. Documentation of experiments, results, and findings in an electronic laboratory notebook; presentation of work to supervisor, subteam, group, department, and cross-functional meetings. Maintenance of instruments and troubleshooting of instrumental/experimental problems. Collaboration with peers to complete core deliverables while exhibiting independence in planning, experimental execution with appropriate controls, data interpretation, and decision-making. Communication with all levels of the organization. Coaching, mentorship, and performance planning with direct reports and other members of the organization as needed. This Role Might Be For You If You Enjoy a fast paced pilot scale laboratory setting where sound science and team work are priorities. Contribute to lab safety and equipment maintenance to help create a safe, effective and efficient working environment. Anticipate and recognize potential problems and act to prevent and tackle problems. Can ensure training and/or compliance responsibilities are maintained. Are scientifically curious, enthusiastic, and proactively ask questions to learn or seek clarification. Have an interest in a positional or non-positional leadership role within a collaborative team. The role requires a bachelor’s and/or master’s degree in either chemical engineering, biochemical engineering, or biochemistry, and 4+ years’ experience in the biotech or pharmaceutical industry. A strong fundamental understanding of various protein purification techniques is a plus. Experience with downstream development and with equipment like Akta Explorers/Avants/Pilots, chromatography columns, tangential flow filters, depth filters, HPLCs, and UPLCs as well as software such as Empower, Unicorn, JMP, and LIMS is a plus. Job will periodically require short duration physical exertions, including light-medium weight lifting. Does this sound like you? Apply now to take your first steps toward living the Regeneron Way! jobTitle: Process Development Engineer II, Upstream Gene Therapy Development
jobDescription: The Preclinical Manufacturing and Process Development group is looking for a Process Development Engineer II: Upstream Development – Gene Therapy, responsible for upstream development efforts to support manufacturing process development functions. In this role you will work as part of a multi-functional team to provide Adeno-Associated Virus (AAV) manufacturing processes and products with the aim of providing treatment to unmet medical needs through gene therapy. This is a growth opportunity that combines the excitement and opportunity of a start-up with the security and institution knowledge gained from working for a larger firm. A Typical Day In The Role Might Look Like As part of the viral vector process development team, design optimized, characterized and robust seed train and bioreactor processes for the upstream production of viral vectors in suspension cell lines suitable for future GMP clinical production. Support the optimization of transfection and bioreactor parameters for viral production using multivariate design of experiment approaches. Conduct technology development studies aimed at enhancing the understanding of or improving viral production process. Cross-train on and provide support for analytical and downstream operations. Develop expertise in theory and practice of manufacturing steps and analytical methods. Support the customization of LIMS system and data visualization system for viral production. Document experiments, results and findings in electronic laboratory notebook; present work at group and department meetings. Maintain instruments and fixes instrumental/experimental problems. Support of weekend or off-hour experimental and pilot scale work, as required. This Role Might Be For You If You A strong fundamental understanding of the principles of upstream process development. History of developing upstream steps within bioprocesses. Experience with bioreactor scale up and operations. Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills. Must have strong initiative and drive to complete meaningful tasks and learn new technologies. Must be capable of multi-tasking, working both independently and within a team environment. This position requires a Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree in either Chemical Engineering, Biochemical Engineering, Biochemistry, or related field, with 3-5+ years of meaningful experience. The chosen candidate would have experience with some of the following systems : NOVA FLEX, AMBR250 bioreactors, Bench top bioreactors, Single-use bioreactors (50-500 L), Biosafety cabinets, incubators, autoclave, Rockwell RSView32, Pi Historian, JMP, LIMS. Prior experience with producing AAV-based gene therapies is a plus. This job will periodically require short duration physical exertions, including light-medium weight lifting. We are currently looking for a Process Sciences Associate with a Monday-Friday, 8am-4:30pm schedule. Are you looking to join a diverse, multi-disciplinary team for a global leading, innovative Biotechnology company that produces life-transforming medicines? Regeneron is looking for highly motivated individuals who possess a problem solving and continuous improvement mind-set to fill our Process Sciences Associate position within our Integrated Manufacturing Support team. A Process Sciences Associate is a scientific role passionate about problem solving to perform scientific and technical investigations, as well as to serve as a subject matter expert (SME) to support biopharmaceutical production activities across the Industrial Operations and Product Supply (IOPS) Rensselaer site. This is a non-lab-based position. Individuals must maintain a high degree of integrity and honesty at all times, demonstrate the ability to work independently and collaboratively, as well as meet commitments within a dynamic environment while utilizing strong time management and organizational skills. In this fast-paced environment with a strong pipeline, a Process Sciences Associate has an opportunity to work on countless aspects of the process and business. As a Process Sciences Associate, a typical day might include the following: Lead, author, and/or review scientific root cause investigations and develop corrective action plans to resolve complex deviations related to process control and product quality. Perform data analysis and apply statistical process control tools for trending and analyzing process related data to drive consistency and improvements Serve as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) by utilizing a science-based approach and through analysis of historical data to support biopharmaceutical production activities in commercial and clinical operations across the Industrial Operations and Product Supply (IOPS) Rensselaer site. Present process data and investigational findings at group and department meetings. Monitoring production processes to proactively acquire vital data in support of preventing issues and tracking efficiency of changes. Interact with Manufacturing, Quality Assurance, Quality Control, Manufacturing Sciences & Technology, and other Process Sciences teams to drive root cause investigations and implement process improvements. We are currently looking to fill a Process Sciences Associate position on our CORE (Cross-Operational Research Extension) team with a 2nd shift, Monday-Friday, 6pm-2:30am schedule. Presents findings at group, and possibly, at interdepartmental meetings. This Role Might Be For You If Experience with mammalian cell culture expansion using aseptic technique. Knowledge of small-scale, fed-batch bioreactors (2L). Lab skills in protein separation, filtration and purification. Attention to detail. Strong interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills. Ability to operate efficiently in a fast-paced lab environment. Flexible and able to adapt quickly to change. Strong organizational skills and ability to multi-task. Good record-keeping skills and understanding of GDP. jobTitle: Process Sciences Associate - Process Control Development and Lifecycle Management
jobDescription: Regeneron is looking for a Process Sciences Associate to join our Process Controls Development and Lifecycle Management Team. This position is a Monday-Friday 8am-4:30pm schedule. Regeneron has successfully commercialized numerous antibody therapies. Gaining approval from regulatory agencies is dependent on demonstrating that our processes are robust, consistent, and produce quality product, done in part through process controls applied to our production processes. The Process Sciences Associate will collect and analyze data from across the business to develop robust Process Control programs. In this fast-paced environment with a strong pipeline, a Process Sciences Associate has an opportunity to work on countless aspects of the process and business. As a Process Sciences Associate, a typical day might include the following: Working with a multi-functional team to support technology transfer and scale-up of processes from Regeneron’s process development team Analyzing development studies, enrichment studies, process validation and characterization studies, chemical stability studies, and/or historical manufacturing data to support development of process control programs. Evaluating product and process risks and providing justification for implementing process controls or for making updates to existing process control programs. Assessing criticality of product attributes to support creation of product specifications. Drafting process control documents, including Process Control Strategy documents, In-Process Control (IPC) Development Reports, and Process Performance Monitoring Plans, including setting relevant limits using appropriate scientific rationale or statistical analysis, where appropriate. Coordinating with stakeholders to obtain additional data as needed to support creation, updates, and changes to process control programs. Presenting process control program structure, rationale, and methodologies during cross-functional meetings and to senior leadership when required. Participating in brainstorming sessions where we look for ways to continuously improve our Process Control Development and Lifecycle Management processes. This Role Might Be For You If You Understand antibody manufacturing processes. Enjoy working in a fast-paced environment. You are detail oriented, quality driven and well organized. You have the innate ability to balance multiple projects, prioritize them and execute them independently, while excelling at keeping all impacted parties well advised. Can take on new and sometimes ambiguous challenges, learning quickly. You enjoy working in a team environment but can also take ownership of multi-faceted projects and technical reports. Can develop and drive scientific and/or business-related improvement ideas. Have a solid understanding of Microsoft Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint). To be considered for the Process Sciences Associate you must be willing and able to work Monday-Friday 8am-4:30pm. You must have a BS/BA in life sciences/engineering or related field; Chemical Engineering or Biochemistry preferred, as is a practical understanding of statistical methods. For various levels you must have the following: Process Sciences Associate I: BS/BA in life sciences/engineering or related field; Chemical Engineering or Biochemistry preferred, as is a practical understanding of statistical methods Process Sciences Associate II: BS/BA in life sciences/engineering or related field; Chemical Engineering or Biochemistry preferred, as is a practical understanding of statistical methods. 2+ years of relevant experience Level is determined based on qualifications relevant to the role. jobTitle: Process Sciences Associate- Process Data Monitoring
jobDescription: Regeneron is looking to for a Process Sciences Associate to join our Process Data Management team. Process Data Management supports the Manufacturing and Process Sciences departments through monitoring of manufacturing process performance, performing data analyses, and using quality engineering tools to ensure Regeneron continues to produce safe and effective products. This position will be responsible for using statistical process control and visualization tools to monitor Drug Product (DP) manufacturing process performance, identify trends, and support investigations. In this fast-paced environment, Process Sciences Associates have an opportunity to work on numerous aspects of the process and business. As a Process Sciences Associate, a typical day might include the following: Analyzing DP manufacturing process data, identifying trends, and raising abnormalities. Creating new analytical tools, dashboards or data models using historical data to predict and understand process trends. Collaborating with other departments (DP Process Sciences, DP MSAT, External Manufacturing, etc.) to support the efficient monitoring of Drug Product manufacturing processes. Using project management skills to work cross functionally to develop new, or improve existing, dashboards to meet user needs. Presenting on project status, team metrics, and DP manufacturing data during cross functional meetings. Leverage existing data sources and organize the acquisition of data to support visualization on dashboards. Training members of other departments on the use of software and analytical tools developed by the team. This Role Might Be For You If You Enjoy working in a fast-paced environment and you have the innate ability to balance multiple projects, prioritize them and execute them independently, while excelling at communicating with all impacted parties. Can take on new and sometimes ambiguous challenges and learn quickly. Have strong attention to detail. Can work in a team environment but can also take ownership of projects. Have a solid understanding of statistics and experience with data aggregation and analysis software. Have experience writing code in one or more programing languages. Can develop and drive scientific and/or business-related improvement ideas. Have understanding of chemical and/or biological chemical processes and controls. jobTitle: Project Analyst, Office of the CIO
jobDescription: We are looking for Project Analyst, Office of the CIO, who will work closely with IT leadership and portfolio team members in support of the successful management and delivery of key projects. Using project portfolio management systems, you will assist project and portfolio leaders with governance activities, data analysis and reporting work. You will help ensure that projects are being conducted in a compliant and fiscally responsible manner. Your analysis will help spotlight accomplishment as well as risks and issues where leadership can engage on corrective action. Your work will prepare the team for important updates with global project management office leaders. Your involvement in project meetings will help keep the team on point with action items and resolutions. Your partnership with key internal partners will help streamline business activities across the team. You will work directly with the Sr. Director, Portfolio Management and the CIO on project priorities and act as an impetus for IT PMO excellence. In this role, a typical day might include the following: Monitor and assess IT project health Analyze budgets, financial forecasts, monthly accruals, and provide financial reporting. Attend monthly/quarterly business reviews. Engage with strategic sourcing team for pipeline updates Seek out and stay close to key issues of the day with portfolio team. Attend meetings with portfolio leadership and assist with minutes and action items Measure and provides reports on IT Business Management progress to procurement, vendor management, project managers, and/or operations teams as necessary support growth cross-department IT relationships (Engineering, InfoSec, QA, etc.) Champion Regeneron PMO best practices, processes, and execution methodologies (waterfall, agile, and others). lead by example on processes and procedures. We are currently looking to fill a Project Associate/Senior Project Associate (Change Control) - CMC Program Management position with an 8:00 am – 4:30 pm Monday through Friday work week. Regeneron successfully manufactures a range of biopharmaceuticals for patients worldwide, including our approved therapeutic proteins and those involved in clinical studies. Serves as primary point of contact between cross-functional areas to facilitate the advancement of projects. Proactively identifies team performance issues and works to resolve with input from manager. Utilizes project management techniques to identify, develop and maintain best practices, templates and planning tools (spreadsheets, MS Project, etc.) in support of projects and standardization across CMC PM / functional areas Leverages proficient understanding of CMC PM processes and tools to manage project work Develops excellent communication and working relationships with individuals within each functional group, including department leaders Identifies continuous improvement and lessons learned opportunities to the team and implements solutions This Role Might Be For You If You Enjoy encouraging a positive team culture of ownership and accountability including continuous evaluation, recognition and process improvement Excel at proactively identifying issues and providing general guidance on resolving CMC program challenges by developing solutions, and is able to call out appropriately in a timely and effective manner Are proactive in trouble shooting and dealing with program, team and cross functional issues. Display comfort in various settings. Display a proven record of coordinating across multiple teams and driving action and accountability. Demonstrate business acuity and successfully engage with higher levels of management as needed. To be considered for the Project Associate/Senior Project Associate, CMC Program Management, you must have a BS/BA in related field and 2 years (PA) or 5 years (Sr PA) of industry experience (project management experience and CAPM certification a plus). We are currently looking to fill a Project Manager of Technology Transfer with a 1st shift, Monday-Friday, 8:00am-4:30pm schedule. Regeneron successfully manufactures a range of biopharmaceuticals for patients worldwide, including our approved therapeutic proteins and those involved in clinical studies. The role is responsible for leading internal and external technology transfer of biopharmaceutical drug substance manufacturing processes for monoclonal antibodies/therapeutic proteins and/or leads cross-functional specialized initiatives such as raw material readiness and raw material technical management in support of technology transfers. Essential Duties and Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following: Leads IOPS technology transfer core team activities to ensure that all relevant information, methods, and materials are successfully communicated and used during manufacturing in accordance with agreed upon timeline Leads specialized initiatives such as raw material readiness, supports and tracks new raw material qualification, aids in identifying alternate raw materials and technical implementation during technology transfers. Coordinates and leads IOPS communications pertaining to tech transfer of the applicable protein to and from collaborative partners, as applicable. Serves as a primary point of contact for project related issues. Generates and reviews documentation supporting technology transfer (e.g., master plans and reports, process descriptions, memos, raw material gap analysis, as appropriate). Prepares, distributes and presents project status reports to project partners, team members and management (both internal and collaborative partners, as applicable). Authors transfer proposals (external collaborations). Leads and/or facilitates investigations associated with tech transfer activities. Leads growth of the organizational process assets (lessons learned repository, risk register, templates, etc.). Identifies and implements new solutions to improve tracking, planning and collaboration; develops tools to improve efficiency. Proactively identifies issues and provides general guidance to resolve project issues and develop solutions to meet project timelines, milestones and objectives. Hosts on-site visits for partners; schedules meetings and training sessions with SMEs. Tracks document approval (e.g., external protocols, records, change requests). May supervise junior level team members and interns. Travel and/or virtual support may be required in support of tech transfer activities. Education And Experience Associate Project Manager: Requires BS/BA in a scientific field and 8 years of related experience in a cGMP environment or equivalent combination of education and experience. The QA Microbiology department is hiring! The QA Microbiology Specialist - Drug Product assists in the planning, coordinating, and facilitating of activities required to maintain sterility assurance throughout the commercialization of Regeneron’s drug candidates. This position may provide floor support during aseptic filling operations, review process data, and provide support for related microbiological investigations. As a QA Microbiology Specialist, a typical day might include: Knowledge, education, experience and training in microbiology, aseptic technique, gowning and microbial control, Environmental Monitoring (EM) for controlled environments, as well as microbiological testing such as bioburden and endotoxin. Proficiency in technical writing. Ability to support the review of microbial control related documents, including but not limited to, SOPs, validation and qualification (IQ/OQ/PQ) documents, study protocols, and investigations. Skills to support departmental project completion including leading cross-functional discussions. Experience using GMP computer system software to process change controls, technical documents, procedures, work instructions, protocols, perform data trending, create metrics etc. Familiarity of regulatory bodies such as Food and Drug Administration (FDA), European Medicines Agency (EMA), Japanese Pharmacopia (JP), etc. Support of Deviations, Change Controls and CAPAs, including active participation in investigation, evaluation, and problem resolution. Proficiency to support the development and delivery of training material to inter- and intra-departmental groups. Knowledge and background to review and assess Contract Manufacturing Organization deviations as it pertains to microbial control. Review and approve partner, raw material, component, and other change notifications as it pertains to microbial control. Ability to work independently with support from management. Identify continuous improvement opportunities within IOPS. Ability to cultivate working relationships between multiple Regeneron departmental representatives. Maintain current knowledge in microbiological practices and methods as they relate to industry and Regeneron expectations. Present microbial events supported by data to leadership. Support of quality audits, regulatory inspections, investigations or matters related to Regeneron Operations. Traveling internationally and/or domestically on occasion. Preferred Experiences For Working On Drug Product Projects Aseptic formulation and Drug Product filling experience. Project Management/Facility Start-up and New Product Introduction (NPI) experience. Knowledge of Clean Utilities Systems and Monitoring Approaches as it pertains to microbial control. Familiarization with Annex 1, FDA Guidance for Industry, and other drug product regulatory guidance. Familiarization with Quality Risk Management Tools, including but not limited too – Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Points (HACCPs), Layers of Protection Analysis (LOPAs), and Failure Modes and Effects Analysis (FMEAs). Develop processes and procedures to support the manufacturing of sterile drug product; such as knowledge in sterility sampling and testing, single-use redundant filtration (SURF), and good isolator operating practices. Supports program development for Aseptic Qualification, Aseptic Process Simulation, and Cleanroom Behaviors as it relates to microbial and sterility control in Drug Product Processing. To be considered for this role you must hold a Bachelor’s degree in the Microbiology, Life Science, or related field and 0-2 years relevant experience in the pharmaceutical/biotechnology or related industry for an Associate Specialist 2+ years relevant experience in the pharmaceutical/biotechnology or related industry for a Specialist 5+ years relevant experience in the pharmaceutical/biotechnology or related industry for a Senior Specialist May substitute related experience for education requirement Level is determined based on qualifications relevant to the role Must be able to enter and work in aseptic controlled environments Does this sound like you? In this role, a typical day might include the following: Reviewing company documentation including SOPs, SPECS, Process Transmittals, and Manufacturing Batch Records to assess MES impact Identifying difficulties and suggesting alternatives that are aligned with QA Reviewing MES change controls and test plans Working with Technical Trainers to develop QA training plans for MES users Collaborating in the creation, review, and approval of validation documents Reviewing and approving MES recipes, design specifications, master batch records, and electronic records to meet the requirements of manufacturing and QA users Supporting Pre-Production Executions (Pre-PE) and delivering feedback Providing end-user support for MES usage and working closely with IT to troubleshoot problems associated with QA functions Support/lead efforts to establish new programs including start-up of formulation, filling, inspection, assembly, and pack and label team Perform assessments of existing procedures/documents to gauge appropriateness for the inclusion of drug product operations; where current documents are not adequate, identify path forward for establishment of procedures Develop, write, review, and approve SOPs, specifications, and other documents. This includes documents for operation and facility SOPs, quality training, batch documentation, etc. Accountable for maintaining project timelines associated with quality assurance initiatives Perform On-The-Floor quality review of documents Review and approval of documents including executed Batch Records and SOPs (electronic and paper-based) Execute daily operations per strategic direction in a multifaceted environment. Provide mentorship during on-the-floor manufacturing Support audits, inspections and investigations. This Role May Be For You If You You have previous QA operations experience, particularly with batch record review / MES design, implementation or training You are a strong communicator and can use effective communication while collaborating with other functions You are driven and self-motivated You seek out new ways to improve processes and make changes accordingly You enjoy project work in a fast paced, startup type environment Role To be considered for this role you must hold a Bachelor’s degree in Life Sciences or related field and following minimum amounts of relevant experience for each level Associate QA Specialist – 2+ years QA Specialist – 4+ years Senior QA Specialist – 6+ years May substitute proven experience for education requirement. Level is determined based on qualifications relevant to the role. #REGNQA Does this sound like you? Apply now to take your first steps toward living the Regeneron Way! jobTitle: QA Validation Specialist - Fill Finish Equipment
jobDescription: The QA Validation department is hiring! The QA Validation Specialist - Oversight validates and qualifies equipment, systems, and processes in accordance with regulatory requirements and support, follow and implement company manufacturing standards policies and procedures. Review and provide quality oversight of the deliverables of validation activities, including, but not limited to: Shipping, Equipment, Computerized Systems, QC and methods, and process. Reviews, edits and approves deviation notifications, deviation investigations, corrective actions, change controls, SOPs, reports and other documentation Coordinates with other departments or outside contractors/vendors to complete validation tasks. May supervise, provide direction and assign work to Validations Specialists and/or contingent workers to meet goals and deadlines. Manages projects and prepares status reports. May present at both internal and external (regulatory) audits Other duties assigned by management. Some travel may be required. The QA Validation Specialist for Equipment Qualification validates and qualifies equipment, systems, and processes in accordance with regulatory requirements and support, follow and implement company manufacturing standards policies and procedures. Exercises judgment in ensuring that written procedures are followed and in evaluating quality systems, processes, procedures, and protocols for compliance. Appropriately raises any compliance issues. Regeneron successfully manufactures a range of biopharmaceuticals for patients worldwide, including our approved therapeutic proteins and those involved in clinical studies. jobTitle: R&D Associate (Cell Culture for Therapeutic Antibody Discovery)
jobDescription: Regeneron's Protein Expression Sciences (PES) group, located in Tarrytown, NY, is seeking a motivated Research Associate to join our human antibody isolation team, which contributed to the development of Regeneron’s Sars-Cov2 antibody cocktail (REGEN-COV). You will play an integral part in the identification of antibodies to treat diseases with unmet medical needs. The primary functions of this position are the isolation of monoclonal antibodies from human donors against diverse disease targets (eg. infections, immune disorders, etc) and the development of new antibody isolation technologies. Some experiments will require mice work such as organ harvesting and dissection. A Typical Day May Include Isolating PBMCs from human peripheral blood Performing cell enrichment, cell culture, antibody staining and phenotypic characterization Independently designing, conducting, and analyzing multicolor flow-cytometry experiments Harvesting mouse spleen, lymph nodes and/or bone marrow Optimizing and carrying out functional assays such as ELISA Performing molecular biology experiments, including DNA/RNA purification, RT-PCR and molecular cloning Analyzing and presenting data in a team-based setting Maintaining complete, accurate, and timely records of experiments and data analysis Contributing to lab equipment maintenance and ordering supplies/reagents to help create a safe, effective, and efficient working environment This Role May Be For You If You Can work in a collaborative fast paced working environment Have a strong desire to develop your skills Are an independent thinker and have problem solving abilities Excel at maintaining experimental documentation To be considered for this position, you must have a minimum of MS or BS+2 years of experience in Immunology, Biology, Biochemistry, or related discipline. Level will be commensurate with experience. We are looking for someone with hands-on technical experience in cell culture and/or PBMC isolation who is comfortable handling mice. Knowledge of flow cytometry is highly desired, but training can be provided if necessary. Experience with functional assays (ELISA, ELISPOT) and molecular biology techniques (DNA/RNA/qRT-PCR, cloning) is a plus. Does this sound like you? jobTitle: R&D Associate, Genetic Engineering (open to entry level candidates)
jobDescription: We are seeking a R&D Associate to join the VelocImmune Next Group of Regeneron Pharmaceuticals Inc. at Tarrytown, NY. The successful candidate will generate, characterize, and optimize “next” generation mouse models with genetically engineered immune systems through the construction of long targeting vectors and/or use of CRISPR/Cas9 gRNAs. A Typical Day Might Include As a Researcher on the VI next team, your responsibilities will include both in vivo and in vitro responsibilities. Utilizing basic molecular biology techniques including PCR and restriction enzyme cloning Learning and implementing more advanced cloning strategies such as Gibson assembly, Cas9-assisted modifications, and homologous recombination of Bacterial Artificial Chromosomes Manipulating eukaryotic cells in vitro for protein expression or nucleic acid profiling Carrying out protein-based techniques such as BCA assays, ELISAs, and Western Blotting for downstream applications Performing immunizations and collect blood and postmortem tissue from mice Processing tissue samples and perform flow cytometry analysis Generating experimental reports and maintain accurate records in an electronic notebook Analyzing data using biological and statistical software such as Flowjo, MacVector, Sequencher, Prism, etc Integrating novel technologies to increase work efficiency by optimizing current protocols and developing new techniques/assays This Role Might Be For You If You have strong organizational, time-management, and presentation skills. You possess excellent interpersonal skills and the ability work both in team and independent environments. You are able to work on multiple projects and prioritize as needed. To be considered for this opportunity, candidates must have a minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in a related field with 1-4 years of research lab experience. Candidates must have a strong passion for biological science and technology, with a drive to continually learn. Candidates should have a solid understanding of genetics and molecular biology with hands-on lab experience in molecular biology, cell culture, and/or cell-based assays. Candidates should have basic computer skills including Microsoft Office, and familiarity with finding and analyzing published research articles. They should also be able to transcribe full experimental records in a timely and well-organized fashion. #RDRARS Does this sound like you? Summary VelocImmune (VI) Next is a technology development group at Regeneron that invents and develops state-of-the-art tools for biologic drug discovery. We are seeking a motivated, highly organized researcher to support our investigations of new antibody and cell-based therapies. This is an opportunity for a researcher with strong molecular & immunology skills to contribute to the development of industry-leading technologies and medicines. As an R&D Associate, a typical day might include the following: Conducting and supporting experiments, independently and collaboratively, investigating new technologies in antibody gene therapeutics. Constructing DNA vectors, viral vectors, and cell-lines for in vitro and in vivo studies of candidate therapeutics. Maintaining, manipulating, and analyzing of mammalian cells lines and primary cells, using Crispr/Cas9, viral vectors, flow cytometry, and immunologic assays. Performing in vivo test of engineered cells; immunophenotyping and molecular analysis of new mouse models. Careful, thorough record keeping, data analysis using biological and statistical software such as Flowjo, MacVector and GraphPad Prism, presentation of results in formal and informal meetings. This May Be The Role For You If You have strong organizational, time-management, and presentation skills. You can function in a highly collaborative environment and actively communicate the result and experimental plan with collaborators. You are naturally curious and enjoy learning. You have a strong desire to develop your skills as well as your career. Job Requirements To be considered for this opportunity, you must possess a minimum of Bachelor’s Degree with 2+ years’ experience or MS +0 years’ experience in Immunology, Molecular Biology, Biochemistry, or relevant program. Strong skills and experience with mammalian cell line and primary immune cell culture are required. Handling and manipulating mice, and other experience with in vivo mouse models, is strongly preferred. Knowledge and background in immunology is strongly preferred, including experience with multi-parameter flow cytometry and other immuno-assays (ELISA, Elispot, MSD, cytotoxicity, proliferation, etc.). Strong skills in molecular biology and cloning, including vector construction, PCR, and extraction/analysis of DNA, RNA, and proteins is desired. Knowledge of NGS methods is a plus. An ability and desire to design experiments, problem-solve, and troubleshoot independently. Ideas and independent thinking are highly encouraged. #RDRARS Does this sound like you? Regeneron's Therapeutic Antibodies MAPCORE group is looking for a highly motivated R&D Associate to join our team. jobTitle: R&D Specialist, Formulation Development (AAV, Gene Therapy)
jobDescription: Regeneron's Formulation Development Group (FDG) is seeking a highly motivated R&D Specialist as we work to support all stages of pre-clinical, clinical and commercial formulation and drug product development for Regeneron's Genetic Medicine. We apply biochemical, biophysical and bioanalytical methods to carry out characterization and development studies primarily on viral vector-based gene therapy to support formulation and drug product development. In addition, we also support the development of antibody-based programs and will conduct research in collaborations with colleagues in Research and Preclinical Development to develop new technologies and platforms. A Typical Day Might Look Like Design and implement formulation development, characterization, and stability studies to support formulation and drug product development for viral vector-based gene therapy (e.g. AAV) and antibody programs. Develop phase-appropriate biochemical and biophysical methods as well as high-throughput biophysical methods for characterization of stability and degradation mechanisms of candidate molecules and drug products. Perform sample analysis supporting FDG activities Author technical documents, such as formulation development technical reports, to support the process development, manufacturing and regulatory filings. Apply statistical science knowledge for study design and data analysis. Present work at group, department, and cross-functional meetings. This Role Might Be For You If Good understanding of protein chemistry, biophysical/biochemical characterization of proteins, analytical method development, structure biology, and biomolecule product development is desirable. Hands-on experience with biochemical and biophysical techniques for protein characterization such as chromatography (SEC, IEX, RP), viscosity, gel electrophoresis (CE-SDS, MCE, cIEF, iCE), particle size (DLS, HIAC, MFI), spectroscopy (UV-Vis, CD, AUC, fluorescence), and thermostability characterization (DSC, DSF) is desirable. Ability to prioritize and lead multiple tasks. Thorough, self-motivated, effective team member with, good oral and written communication skills. To be considered, you must have a BS degree with 5+ years or MS degree with 2+ years relevant laboratory experience. Degrees in Pharmaceutical Sciences, Biochemistry, Biophysics, Molecular Biology, Chemistry, Biomedical Engineering, or a related field are desirable. Regeneron's Formulation Development group (FDG) is seeking a highly motivated R&D Associate or Specialist. You will be involved with clinical and commercial formulation and drug product development activities including protein stability and characterization and will also support manufacturing process development, gene therapy modalities, and drug delivery technologies. Experience with chromatography methods (HPLC, UPLC, column chromatography,CEX, AEX, SEC, IPRP, RP), visible and subvisible particle analysis (MFI, HIAC), capillary electrophoresis (MCE, iCIEF) and/or biophysical techniques (UV-vis, DLS, FTIR, DSC, AUC, Fluorescence, Raman spectroscopy) for characterization is desirable. Summary/Position Objective The Review Committee Specialist role is the lead for coordinating Regeneron’s promotional Review Committee (Medical, Legal, and Regulatory) activities and for ensuring the promotional review processes are conducted both in a highly compliant manner and in a timely and efficient manner. We are seeking a hard-working Sample Management Specialist to add to our growing team. You will independently perform sample management activities in their area, lead operation of automated sample storage systems, and facilitate the import/export of samples using the system user interface and integration with LIMS. Lead operation of liquid handling systems to facilitate the sub-aliquoting of samples to support bioanalytical and research needs. As a Sample Management Specialist, a typical day might include the following: Interpreting subject treatment information, entering information into LIMS, and assisting in the request and maintenance of blinded treatment information from Biostatistics and Data Management. Performing the accessioning and receipt of non-clinical/clinical samples by assessing and verifying data, both manually and applying Microsoft VBA tools. Fulfilling clinical and/or non-clinical sample requests to support bioanalysis results as well as company-wide research initiatives and assisting in facilitating sample transfer documentation and review. Facilitating data reporting needs for clinical/non-clinical/research study queries surrounding sample inventory. Working closely with Quality Control (QC) to address findings and ensure data is collected appropriately in LIMS. Active participant in development, testing, validation, and implementation of new LIMS functionalities Reviewing and editing sample collection instructions to be incorporated in the study lab manual. Understanding the ELN and uses it for data documentation and proactively participating in efforts to improve both physical and electronic inventory management systems. Ensuring a state of audit readiness by actively participating in the preparation of supporting documents for Quality Assurance & Auditing (QAA). Communicating with CRO’s and third-party vendors to supporting sample management responsibilities. Ensuring compliance and accurate documentation in accordance with working instructions, SOPs, and applicable regulations. This Role May Be For You If You enjoy working in a highly collaborative setting You have the ability to multi-task in order to drive multiple projects to completion You can establish effective relationships to influence and gain cooperation of others. To be considered for this opportunity, you must have a minimum of a Bachelor's degree with 5+ years experience or a Master's degree with 3+ years of lab related experience. We need someone with a sophisticated knowledge of LIMS software and carry out LIMS functions to support sample management activities, including study creation based on protocols and supporting documents. Must have extensive knowledge of Microsoft Excel and be able to independently analyze discrepancies in sample metadata. Does this sound like you? Regeneron Pharmaceutical’s Analytical Chemistry Group is seeking a highly motivated Scientist to join our group. Scientists work with LC-MS technologies to guide and support development and characterization of therapeutic protein candidates and other modalities. We apply and solid understanding of various LC-MS platforms and applications to solve analytical problems. The ideal candidate will have a robust background in mass spectrometry-based protein and/or oligonucleotide analysis, strong critical thinking skills, a passion for science, and effective interpersonal and communication skills to work productively in cross-functional teams and achieve program goals. A TYPICAL DAY IN THE ROLE OF A SCIENTIST MIGHT LOOK LIKE: Design, complete, and effectively communicate analytical characterization of biotherapeutics, including monoclonal and bispecific antibodies, Fc-fusion proteins, and other modalities (adeno-associated virus, mRNA, siRNA, etc.) to support drug discovery and development. Lead and deliver on characterization activities to elucidate product quality attributes like post-translational modifications, sequence variants, charge variants, size variants, and host cell proteins. Form and maintain inter-departmental collaborations to solve any potential drug development issues. We find opportunities to advance LC-MS analysis of biotherapeutics by developing technical innovations that will contribute to future developmental needs and/or efficiency gains. Document experiments, results, and findings in electronic laboratory notebook (ELN) entries. Present results during internal and external meetings. Prepare and review regulatory submission documents like IND, comparability, and BLA reports, as well as manuscripts for publication in peer-reviewed journals. Serve as a team representative and provide analytical knowledge and expertise to cross-functional teams. This Job Might Be For You If You are a critical-thinker and excel at identifying and solving problems. You thrive in creative and flexible team environments. You are self-motivated and can lead and coordinate multiple projects in a timely manner. To be successful in this role, candidates must be thorough, diligent, highly efficient, and capable of collaborating within a team and with external partners. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are also essential to this position. To be considered you must have a MS degree +6 years experience or a PhD in Analytical Chemistry, Biochemistry, Pharmaceutical Sciences, or a closely related field, with 2+ years of experience in mass spectrometry-based analysis of proteins and/or other biological molecules (e.g., oligonucleotides, mRNA, lipid nanoparticles, viral vectors). Extensive experience with advanced mass spectrometers (Q-TOF, Orbitrap, Q-Exactive, Triple Quadrupole, etc.), liquid chromatographs, and data processing software (Proteome Discoverer, Skyline, Protein Metrics, MaxQuant, etc.) is desired. Knowledge and hands-on experience in gene therapy analytics (AAVs, mRNA, siRNA) is a plus. #REGNGeneTherapyAD Does this sound like you? jobTitle: Scientist, Analytical Chemistry (siRNAs, mRNAs, LNPs, AAVs, CRISPR-Cas)
jobDescription: Our Analytical Chemistry Group (ACG) at Regeneron is seeking a highly motivated Scientist/Senior Scientist in support of Regeneron Genetics Medicines (RGM) development. We work in a mass spectrometry lab and focuses on the biochemical characterization of emerging novel therapeutic modalities as well as therapeutic monoclonal antibodies at all stages of development. In this role, you will develop LC-MS methods and/or other analytical strategies for elucidating and characterizing novel therapeutics (oligonucleotides, siRNAs, mRNAs, LNPs, AAVs, CRISPR-Cas, etc) and antibody attributes such as primary structures, disulfide linkages, PTMs, product and process related impurities, charge/size variants, sequence variants, etc. You will conduct analytical method qualification for late-stage antibody and/or RGM drug development programs and develop innovative technologies to support a diverse Regeneron's R&D pipeline. A Typical Day In This Role Looks Like Develop LC-MS based analytical methods to support RGM novel therapeutics development as well as the development of monoclonal antibody-based therapeutic proteins and inform critical quality attributes, develop ability assessment and risk mitigation strategies in collaboration with other CMC teams. Perform LC-MS data analysis using various software and bioinformatic tools to elucidate the quality attributes of therapeutic proteins and other novel modalities. Assume a leading role to support R&D activities and regulatory applications and deepen our knowledge of antibody therapeutics and other emerging novel modalities. Lead sample preparation and LC-MS-based experiments based on SOPs and document experiments, results and findings in electronic laboratory notebook (ELN) entries; present data at group and project meetings; write technical reports, SOPs, and regulatory filing reports, etc. Summarize results in a concise format (graphs, figures, tables, etc.) to support presentations, peer-reviewed publications, and regulatory documents, etc. This Role May Be For You If You have knowledge and hands-on experience in LC-MS based sample preparation for proteins and peptides are preferred. Experience in quantitative proteomics is preferred. A consistent record of publication in the field of LC-MS is a strong plus. Experience with automated liquid handling system (Biomek, Bravo, King Fisher, Tecan, etc) is a plus. Experience with DoE, molecular modeling, graphing and statistical analysis software is a plus. Strong verbal and written communication skills as well as good interpersonal skills are essential. The ability to learn new technologies and solve problems is essential. A passion for science and motivation to contribute in a team environment is necessary. This role is for you if you are motivated, results-driven, efficient, and able to perform key responsibilities in an innovative, fast-paced, team environment. To be considered for this role, you must have a PhD degree in Chemistry, Biochemistry, Analytical Chemistry, Pharmaceutical Sciences, or a related field with 0-3 years of post-doctoral or industrial experience, or a MS degree with 3-8 years of work experience in analytical characterization of antibodies, ADCs, protein therapeutics, oligonucleotides, siRNAs, mRNAs, LNPs, AAVs, CRISPR-Cas, and other therapeutic modalities. #REGNGeneTherapyAD Does this sound like you? The Molecular Profiling and Data Science Department is looking for an enthusiastic and motivated Computational Scientist who values independent research in an open and collaborative working environment. You will participate in original studies that span from basic research to translation studies, directly impacting the lives of patients. You will also have the opportunity to develop novel computational methods from internal and external big data resources. You will join a diverse and inspiring team which cultivates discussion across scientists of differing backgrounds at the exciting intersection of function genomics, gene therapy, machine learning, and neuroscience. We work closely with biological researchers from different scientific functions, especially the departments of Neuroscience, Aging, VelociGene and Precision Medicine, to address critical scientific questions. As a Computational Scientist, a typical day might include the following: Lead computational efforts in neuroscience by developing or applying innovative methods from single cell genomics, epigenomics, spatial transcriptomics and other sequencing technologies. Discuss and analyze molecular profiling data generated from gene interference strategies such as CRISPR-Cas9 for target discovery and therapy development Develop computational methodologies to integrate multiple data modalities to gain new biology insights Work in concert with pre-clinical and clinical teams to design next-generation sequencing and digital phenotyping experiments, draft data analysis plans, and provide critical analytics support. Prepare presentations and documentations for collaborators and senior management. Publish and present novel findings in peer-reviewed journals and conferences. Contribute to our team efforts in formulating analytical pipelines and benchmarked standards. This Job Might Be For You If You are passionate about understanding and applying efficient computational techniques to address biological questions. Bring innovative thinking to multi-omics data analysis. Have a strong work ethic and are proactive in providing solutions to foster scientific collaborations and drive projects forward within Regeneron. Can effectively communicate with collaborators with various backgrounds. Value teamwork and team excellence. To be considered for this role, you must have a PhD degree in Bioinformatics, Biomedical Engineering, Biophysics, Computational Biology, Chemical Engineering, Computer Science, or related quantitative field. Experience with conducting bioinformatics analysis (e.g. bulk and single cell RNA-Seq, ATAC-Seq, spatial transcriptomics, alternative splicing, genomic variation). Strong background (2+ years preferred) in at least in one of the following scripting languages: R, Python, MATLAB. Experience working with single cell analysis tools such as Seurat, Scanpy, etc. Experience working with clinical samples is a plus. Familiarity in working in a Linux environment, shell scripting and Jupyter Notebook environment. Experience with public transcriptomics database such as Human Cell Atlas, Allen Brain Atlas, and GTEx is preferable. Experience with cloud-based big-data analytics and machine learning to integrate omics data with other modalities such as images and sensor readouts is highly valued. Does this sound like you? The Molecular Profiling and Data Science Department is looking for an enthusiastic and motivated Computational Scientist who values independent research in an open and collaborative working environment. You will participate in original studies that span from basic research to translation studies, directly impacting the lives of patients. You will also have the opportunity to develop novel computational methods from internal and external big data resources. You will join a diverse and inspiring team which cultivates discussion across scientists of differing backgrounds at the exciting intersection of genomics, technology development, machine learning, and immuno-oncology. We work closely with biological researchers from different scientific functions, especially the departments of Immunology and Inflammation, Oncology and Angiogenesis, Infectious Disease, and Precision Medicine, to address critical scientific questions. As a Computational Scientist, a typical day might include the following: Lead computational efforts in the Immuno-Oncology (IO) field by developing or applying innovative methods from single cell genomics, epigenomics, spatial transcriptomics and other sequencing technologies. Discuss and analyze immuno-therapeutic strategies such as vaccines and antibody blockade. Work in concert with oncology pre-clinical and clinical teams to design next-generation sequencing experiments, draft data analysis plans, and provide critical analytics support. Prepare presentations and documentations for collaborators and senior management. Publish and present novel findings in peer-reviewed journals and conferences. Contribute to our team efforts in formulating analytical pipelines and benchmarked standards. This Job Might Be For You If You are passionate about understanding and applying efficient computational techniques to address biological questions. Bring innovative thinking to multi-omics data analysis. Have a strong work ethic and are proactive in providing solutions to foster scientific collaborations and drive projects forward within Regeneron. Can effectively communicate with collaborators with various backgrounds. Value teamwork and team excellence. To be considered for this role, you must have a PhD degree in Computational Biology, Systems Biology, Quantitative Biology, Bioinformatics, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, or related quantitative field. Experience with conducting bioinformatics analysis (e.g. single cell RNA-seq, ATAC-seq, bulk transcriptomic analysis). Strong background (2+ years preferred) in at least in one of the following scripting languages: R, Python, MATLAB. Experience working with single cell analysis tools such as Seurat, Scanpy, etc. Experience working with clinical samples is a plus. Familiarity in working in a Linux environment, shell scripting and Jupyter Notebook environment. Experience with public transcriptomics database such as human cell atlas, mouse cell atlas, and TCGA is preferable. Experience with cloud-based big-data analytics and machine learning to develop predictive models of immunotherapy response is highly valued. Does this sound like you? We are seeking an independent Scientist with strong expertise in integrative metabolism, particularly in metabolic disease research. The Metabolic and Muscle Disease group at Regeneron is committed to discovering novel targets and innovative medicines to treat obesity, diabetes, dyslipidemia, NASH and muscle diseases. We hope you are excited by the opportunity to guide and execute rigorous mechanistic studies for target discovery, validation, and novel therapeutic development. As a Scientist, a typical day might include the following: Independently designing, conducting, analyzing, and troubleshooting rigorous in-vivo and in-vitro experiments to drive projects. Identifying and implementing novel areas, technologies, and approaches for validating targets and modalities to support novel therapeutic development. Synthesizing results across programs and communicating progress and discoveries within the Muscle and Metabolic Disease Group and across different functions. This Role May Be For You If You are motivated, team-oriented, and productive with proven scientific problem-solving abilities. You thrive in a creative, flexible, team environment. You excel in a fast-track environment while contributing to multiple projects. You are a leader and enjoy driving ideas and projects forward. You have strong communication and presentation skills. To be considered for this opportunity, you must have a M.D. or Ph.D. with at least 3 years of postdoctoral training in metabolism and/or diabetes research. We are seeking a proven publication record demonstrating productivity and scientific rigor. Experience in biochemistry, molecular biology, in vivo and ex-vivo assays are required. Strong hands-on experience with human iPS and human ES cell work, including culture, differentiation, and genome editing is desirable for the position, but not required. Does this sound like you? Our Formulation Development Group is looking for a highly motivated PhD Scientist to join in the development of innovative biological drug products at all phases including early to late clinical and commercial stages. In this role, you will develop antibody-based and other novel biologic drug products, and develop new analytical methods to assess their quality and stability. As a Scientist, you will collaborate with various teams to move drug products from pre-clinical through commercial stages. You will also perform research on biologic drug product stability and characterization, analytical method development and new technology identification and implementation. A Typical Day In The Role May Look Like Responsible for all aspects of formulation and drug product development projects including early and late stages. Conduct biochemical and biophysical characterization and pre-formulation studies to support evaluation of preclinical drug candidates. Independently designs, writes, complete and documents stability studies and other experiments to support formulation development and stability testing in various phases. Develops and applies analytical methods to support product characterization, formulation development, and stability testing of mAbs, bispecifics and other modalities. Performs compatibility and in-use stability studies to support the drug dose administration. Serves as a functional team representative in drug development team meetings, and shares knowledge and expertise of formulations development at cross-functional team meetings. Authors and reviews formulation development sections of regulatory and technical documents, study reports and technology transfer documents. Presents work at group, department, and inter-department meetings. This Role May Be For You If You have a passion for science with a motivation for making contributions in a team environment You thrive in fast-paced environment and be able to balance multiple projects and challenging priorities. You have excellent oral and written communication and organization skills. To be considered, you must have a Ph.D. in Chemistry, Biochemistry, Analytical Chemistry, Pharmaceutical Science or related field with 0-2+ years protein experience and publications in the field of endeavor. Post-doctoral experience is but not required. Expertise in protein chemistry/biochemistry and characterization, with keen analytical and problem-solving skills are a must. Experience with protein stability, structure or biophysics can be useful. Hands-on experience and trouble-shooting proficiency with applying chromatographic methods (HPLC, UPLC, column chromatography), capillary electrophoresis and/or biophysical techniques (UV-vis, DLS, CD, FTIR, DSC, AUC, Fluorescence, Raman spectroscopy, particle analysis, etc.) for protein characterization is a plus. Experience with statistical analysis software (such as JMP) is beneficial. #RDFormulations Does this sound like you? Apply now to take your first steps toward living the Regeneron Way! The Cancer Immunology group in the department of Immunology & Inflammation is seeking a highly skilled and motivated Ph.D. scientist with solid background in functional genomics as well as tumor immunology, to translate discoveries from multi-omics profiling of preclinical cancer models and patient samples into novel therapeutics. We are looking for someone who is passionate about scientific discoveries that will benefit cancer patients as well as individual growth and development. Please see our recent relevant work: https://www.nature.com/articles/s43018-022-00391-0 As a scientist in the Cancer Immunology team, a typical day may include the following: Functional validation of findings from multi-omics profiling by using CRISPR/Cas9 genome editing (knockout, activation, repression) in primary immune cells and cancer cells Deploy functional genomics (CRISPR screens, Perturb-seq) to enable novel targets identification and deep molecular characterization using primary immune cells Edit immune cells by CRISPR technologies ex vivo and examine functional readouts in vivo and in vitro Utilize CRISPR tools to interrogate the identity and function of noncoding regulatory elements in the genome Develop and optimize a variety of immunoassays to evaluate the impact of genomic perturbations on immune cell function Work collaboratively with computational scientists to functionally integrate complex multi-omics data sets derived from preclinical models and patients Proactively identify, evaluate and implement novel technologies (bulk and single-cell) in functional genomics Deliver impactful presentations to colleagues, including senior leadership This Role Might Be For You If You are excited about manipulating therapeutically immune cell states to promote effector function and/or reverse dysfunction You have the ability to innovate and lead new scientific directions You are a strong team player with excellent oral and written communication skills You can independently design and execute experiments, analyze data and interpret results You have the ability to multitask and manage multiple projects simultaneously This role requires a Ph.D. in a related field (immunology/immuno-oncology, molecular biology, biomedical engineering, etc.) with a strong record of innovation and publication. We need someone with strong expertise with CRISPR-Cas9 and CRISPR-dCas9 tools. You must have experience with performing and analyzing genome-wide CRISPR workflows. Experience with high-throughput perturbation technologies using CRISPR/Cas9 genome editing (Perturb-seq, etc.) is desired. We would like someone who has experience with multiparametric flow cytometry. Experience with functional interrogation of the noncoding/regulatory genome, as well as with integration of molecular profiling data including epigenomic, transcriptomic, proteomic, and genomic datasets is a plus. Experience with mouse tumor models (syngeneic and/or xenogeneic) is a plus. Does this sound like you? Apply now to take your first steps toward living the Regeneron Way! We are seeking a highly motivated scientist to join the Genome Engineering Technology group, which addresses a wide range of experimental topics, including genome editing, protein engineering and stem cell differentiation. Our group also works to develop new classes of therapeutics, such as unique protein fusions or cellular immunotherapies. We are seeking candidates with experience in generating and analyzing data derived from single cell and bulk RNA-seq, ATAC-seq or related genomic methods. Such data will be used to characterize immunotherapy cells, organoid cultures, and mouse tissues. Preference will be given to candidates with broad knowledge of eukaryotic molecular and cellular biology, including experience with maintaining and differentiating ES and iPS cells. In addition to supporting ongoing projects, the scientist will be expected to initiate new avenues of research. Ideal candidates are collaborative scientists that have demonstrated strong intellectual curiosity, scientific independence, and a desire to develop new technologies or therapeutics. As a Scientist on the Genome Engineering Technology group, a typical day might include the following: Generating and analyzing data derived from RNA-seq, ChIP-seq, ATAC-seq and related methods. Applying functional genomic and pathway analysis methods to characterize cells, to understand pathway utilization and to improve differentiation protocols. Culture and differentiate human ES cells and iPSCs. Designing and executing experiments according to established protocols. Maintaining clear records of experimental details in a laboratory notebook. Communicating experimental results, conclusions, and ideas directly to supervisors, project team members, and management in presentation form. This Role Might Be For You If You are collaborative, hardworking, flexible and innovative. You can thrive in a fast-paced environment. You have excellent communication and organizational skills. To be considered for this opportunity you must possess a PhD in molecular biology, systems biology, or related field. Experienced in functional genome analysis, with a strong molecular biology background. Enjoys bench science and should be able to work independently with minimal supervision. Positive attitude and willingness to contribute to a goal-oriented team. Desire and willingness to learn new subject matter and techniques. A track record of independent scientific achievement and problem solving as demonstrated through publications. Occasional weekend and evening hours required. Does this sound like you? We are seeking a PhD-level Scientist to join our Neuroscience team at Regeneron Pharmaceuticals. We are working on understanding the molecular mechanisms underlying neuronal damage in a wide range of neurodegenerative diseases including Alzheimer’s, Parkinson’s, ALS, and numerous tauopathies. This role will explore new ways to therapeutically target tauopathies, microglia and neuroinflammation with the aim of identifying novel treatment strategies for targeting neurodegeneration, specifically in Alzheimer’s disease. In this role, you will be entering into a well-established and fully equipped scientific environment and will directly work on projects that are moving toward the clinic, as well as new and upcoming projects where the candidate will have to apply strong scientific rigor and judgment to move science forward. As a Scientist on the Neuroscience team, a typical day might include the following: Target discovery Technology development (e.g., CRISPR screening in vitro or in vivo) Handling large data set analyses (e.g., RNASeq, proteomics) Developing deep biological insights into neurodegenerative & neuroinflammatory diseases Generating and analyzing data derived from RNA-seq, ChIP-seq, ATAC-seq and related methods. This Role Might Be For You If You can bring new ideas, mechanistic insights, and a high level of critical thinking. You can thrive in a fast-paced environment. You have excellent communication and organizational skills. To be considered for this opportunity you must possess a PhD in Neuroscience, Pharmacology or related field with 4+ years of post-doctoral experience, with a consistent track record of publishing. A combination of the expertise areas listed would be a plus: In vitro experience (e.g., primary cell culture, cellular assays; FACS and/or flow cytometry); In vivo mouse (and/or rat) experience (e.g., animal handling, behavioral assays, histology, stereotactic surgeries); Experience with microscopy (e.g., confocal, spinning disc); track-record of scientific productivity (e.g., publications, conference presentations/abstracts).
