Work closely with Brand Teams and other internal stakeholders to ensure the forecast models and associated forecasts reflect the latest information related to the brand and the diseases for which it is indicated in each jurisdiction. Liaison with key commercial and other internal stakeholders to ensure they are aware of and aligned with the latest approved Commercial brand revenue forecast. These constituencies include: Field Incentive Compensation, Field Force Effectiveness, Industrial Operations and Product Supply, Pharmacovigilance, Accounting, Treasury, Inventory Management and Trade. Assist Senior Commercial Management and Corporate Financial Planning & Analysis colleagues with earnings call and external financial guidance preparation. Stay abreast of market and competitive landscape for brand including commercial, regulatory, research and development events for competing products and product candidates. Work with Brand Team(s) to address a variety of business/financial challenges. Support distribution of daily commercial reports to senior management. Ensure 100% compliance with all Regeneron standards operating procedures and policies, as well as governmental and industry regulations governing the sales, marketing, and overall commercialization of prescription pharmaceuticals. This Role Might Be For You If You are a proactive and analytical problem solver with the ability think outside of the box and adept at identifying areas of operational improvement. You have excellent interpersonal and communication skills. You have strong organizational and prioritization skills with an attention to detail. To be considered for this opportunity you must possess a bachelor’s degree in related field, Master’s Degree or MBA a plus as well as a minimum of 2 years of applicable experience, Pharmaceutical or Biotech industry experience preferred. Extensive experience with MS Excel, MS Word, and PowerPoint. Experience working with IQVIA, ICS, Valuecentric, Integrichain, and Tableau data preferred. Technical expertise in modeling, forecasting and finance. Understanding of patient-based modeling. Knowledge of automated systems for statistical analysis and tracking of commercial sales data for forecasting purposes. Experience to develop concepts, techniques, and standards. Ability to analyze Commercial brand and disease epidemiology data to prepare operational and management reports. Strong leadership skills including meeting facilitation, cross-functional team integration, strategic thinking, and advising. Must be able to create an environment for collaborative work for the team to be effective. Gross to Net Accounting familiarity preferred. R920

As a Senior Clinical Data Manager you will serve as the DM study lead and point of contact for clinical study teams and external partners, (e.g, external data vendors and CROs) for multiple trials within a given Therapeutic Area (TA). Oversee DM activities across all stages of the trial from study start-up through archiving to achieve data management results within the assigned drug assets and contributes to department-level goals to ensure timely completion within project budget guidelines and adhering to all applicable policies and procedures. A Typical Day Might Include The Following Provide a high level of expertise in data management to support clinical studies. Provide clear verbal or written information and hands-on support to project team members and to CROs related to eCRF and database design, data quality, and reporting of database / data quality status. Supervise the implementation and execution of procedures for data quality review and data acceptance prior to data analyses and/or database lock. Lead data transfers with CROs and third-party data sources, SAE/AE reconciliation and MedDRA /WHO-DD coding. Support the transfer, locking, and archiving of study databases. Lead scheduling and time constrains across multiple projects. Prepare recommendations for new or improved processes for data management and data flow. This Role May Be For You If Candidates should have working understanding of all applicable regulations including; 21 CFR Part 11, ICH-GCP Guidelines and CDISC standards for data collection. Must have consistent record of leading clinical studies and clinical study teams in a data processing environment and demonstrate robust knowledge of Data Management processes and industry standard methodologies, drawing from wide-ranging experience to resolve complex issues. Strong problem solving, project management, and presentation skills essential to the role are required. Must possess ability to work effectively with and motivate virtual teams in matrix environment and solid understanding of cross-functional activities. Proficient with appropriate EDC applications and Microsoft Office applications. Software proficiency with CDMS required. Experience with JMP and SAS a plus. To be considered you should have Bachelor degree in Mathematics, Science or a related field, minimum of 5 or more years of clinical data management experience in biotech, pharmaceutical or health related industry is required. #BDMJobs Does this sound like you? We are looking for a Senior Java Developer - Laboratory Information Systems who will configure, customize and system admin the information systems supporting the Regeneron Genetics Center's ultra-high-throughput next-generation sequencing lab. Gather requirements for system enhancements and support user acceptance testing. Verify data quality and perform laboratory data entry. The RGC is looking for an experienced director to lead our Computational Biology R&D teams focused on understanding and accurately predicting the functional consequences of genetic variation using a wide variety of approaches. These efforts are in support of world-leading genetic data generation and analysis of millions of genotyped and sequenced humans, where effective functional classification of variants is essential to discovery of meaningful novel insights into phenotype/genotype relationships and defining robust therapeutic hypotheses to drive drug target discovery. You will provide leadership in the design, implementation and refinement of the methods and tools that will enable Regeneron teams to better understand and interpret large-scale -omics data to power genetics-driven drug development efforts. As the Sr Director - Computational Biology, a typical day might include the following: Provide informatics leadership to drive computational biology innovation at Regeneron. Lead a comprehensive functional annotation program specific to the RGC’s unique variation resource. Build, organize and lead teams to develop, deploy, & maintain innovative analysis systems and tools for -omics functional annotation. Lead efforts to train models which can improve our understanding of variant function. Provide scientific insight and domain expertise to help build and deploy novel computational tools and methods into the RGC’s Enterprise Research environment. Summarize and present complex and highly technical problems and solutions to audiences with a wide variety of skills and domain knowledge. This Job Might Be For You If You Enjoy working in a highly interactive and cross-functional collaborative environment with a diverse team of colleagues and partners. You're responsible for hiring, developing, and retaining people to help them develop their full potential and build new skills and abilities. You have a passion for actively directing and managing skilled individuals to consistently achieve high levels of motivation, enthusiasm, inclusion, and performance. To be considered for this role, you must have a PhD in computational biology (or related field) and at least 10 years academic or industry experience leading computational genomics or biology teams is required. Biopharma industry drug development experience is a plus. Experience building and training AI/ML models to better understand the functional impact of human and non-human (especially mice and rats) sequence variation. Experience in applying evolutionary biology to improve our understanding of human health (healthy aging research experience is a plus). Experience working with genomic data from across the whole tree of life, using conservation, constraint, and structural information to inform variant function prediction and provide insight into human biology. Experience in developing deep learning methods, including learning representations and generative models for proteins. Computational biology leadership experience covering the full range from innovative method development to data processing. Expertise with enterprise research workflow-based analysis in modern cloud environments (AWS preferred) is essential. A track record of building, organizing and leading informatics teams with diverse skills and focused on the analysis and interpretation of human genetic data. #RGCGI Does this sound like you? jobTitle: Sr Director, Computational Genomics & Application Development
jobDescription: We are looking for a Sr. Director, Computational Genomics & Application Development to lead the design, implementation and refinement of the tools, methods and pipelines that will enable the analyses of genetic datasets with sequence data on 1,000,000s of human samples to be tracked, completed, interpreted and annotated at scale. You will be joining a very impactful team, which you will help grow. The team already combines expertise in genomics, biology, computation and medicine and is performing and refining analyses that connect genetic variation to human diseases and health at a world leading scale. An ability to mentor and develop people, excellent interpersonal skills to enable coordination between statisticians, bioinformaticians, biologists, clinicians and others, and a vision for high-quality genomic analyses and interpretation tools are all expected. As a Sr. Director, Computational Genomics & App Dev, a typical day might include the following: Imagining and architecting intuitive applications that make genetic data and insights widely accessible to scientists throughout Regeneron. Coordinating with colleagues across the Regeneron Genetics Center to understand analysis needs, coordinate organization of genetic and phenotype datasets, and prioritize improvements to our tools and pipelines. Managing applications that enable genetic association analysis, fine-mapping, polygenic risk scores, mendelian randomization for high priority traits (disease outcomes and progression, related quantitative traits, genomic variables such as proteomics and gene expression). Providing leadership on the analysis of omics data in population scale datasets, where this data will complement standard clinical and epidemiological variables. This Job Might Be For You If You Bring outstanding scientific rigor and a track record in guiding the development of computational methods and their application to real world problems. Are highly familiar with modern human genetic datasets as well as their applications to improve understanding of human biology and/or identification of therapeutic targets. Have a strong work ethic and are proactive in providing solutions to foster scientific collaborations and drive projects forward within Regeneron. Have the ability to work in a highly interactive environment with a diverse team of colleagues. Have outstanding communication skills to summarize and present new statistical methods and concepts and the results of human genetic studies to a variety of technical audiences, ranging from experts in statistical genetics and computation to experts in biology, drug design and medicine. Provide mentorship and guidance to junior colleagues to help them develop their full potential and build new skills and abilities. An outstanding candidate will be able help teams of skilled individuals to consistently achieve high levels of motivation, enthusiasm and performance. Are a motivated leader with a desire to pursue genetic discovery in a multi-disciplinary environment. To be considered for this role, you must have a PhD in Human Genetics, Statistical Genetics, Bioinformatics, Biostatistics, Computer Science, or a related field, together with at least 10 years of research experience. A record in leading complex projects, whether focused on the development of statistical genetic methods and tools or in the analysis of rich human genetic datasets. Demonstrated leadership in relevant publications and patents or through the development of open source tools and methods. Demonstrated deep experience and leadership across one or more of the following areas: the analysis and interpretation of human genetic studies to identify drug targets and their applications, the analysis and interpretation of polygenic risk scores, analysis and interpretation of large scale genomic studies (whether genetic association studies or genomic studies of proteomics, RNA-sequencing, or metabolomics), development of tools and pipelines for processing and interpretation of DNA sequence data (whether for variant calling, quality control), statistical methods in the areas of association analysis, fine-mapping, phasing, imputation and/or modeling of population structure, mendelian randomization and data visualization. Experience in interaction with multidisciplinary teams that range from expertise in engineering to human genetics to biology is strongly desirable. Knowledge of how to organize development processes combining inputs from multi-disciplinary teams is highly preferred. #RGCAG Does this sound like you? We are looking for someone to be responsible for the asset management lifecycle process. The scope of this role includes, but is not limited to, day to day coordination of Laboratory Equipment Service, Laboratory Equipment Business Reviews, Preventative Maintenance, Service Ticket Follow-Up and Reconciliation. This role requires working heavily with end users in the Research and Product Development laboratories and equipment/service suppliers. A Typical Day Might Include The Following Laboratory Equipment Service Requests (LESR): Coordinate Laboratory Equipment Service Requests (LESR) from receipt of service request, to scheduling, follow-up, tracking site access, and completion of service requests. Laboratory Equipment Scheduling, Follow-Up & Confirmations: Send scheduling requests, perform follow-up for unscheduled requests/requests that are pending action, reviews team member in preparation of service visit confirmations for all scheduled visits. Laboratory Equipment Service Request Reconciliation: Coordinate with end users and suppliers to obtain laboratory asset service reports for completed requests and ensure each request includes the proper asset information and associated documentation. Laboratory Equipment Service Visit Documentation Follow-up: Send follow-up emails to prescheduled visitors who require additional documentation prior to service visits occurring. Preventative Maintenance: Compile asset information from Asset Database and work with vendors to schedule annual equipment maintenance visits for 5,000+ assets. Meetings & Presentations: Assist with scheduling laboratory equipment related meetings, distribute detailed meeting summaries and support with basic presentation review Laboratory Equipment Service Data: Support with creating and organizing laboratory equipment service data reports and distributing to key partners. This Role Might Be For You If You Are Comfortable communicating with multiple people and coordinating multiple projects, simultaneously Driven/Self Starter; Ability to perform work duties with supervision (needs little direction needed and energized to work independently, once trained) Database familiarity (ability to work in multiple databases and pick-up on database learning easily) Experience with & thrive working in a fast-paced environment Strong interest in growing their career and welcoming new opportunities/job tasks Ability to work within a team environment with an enthusiastic and positive “can-do” work attitude. The ideal candidate for this role will have a bachelor’s degree and 1-2 years’ experience with coordination of services. Does this sound like you? We are currently looking to fill the position of Senior IT Applications Analyst in the Quality Control Systems group. As an Applications Analyst, you will be a vital member of a team responsible for the implementation and support of the Labware LIMS application. A significant focus of this role is ensuring quality and compliance in a highly regulated cGMP environment. The systems we support are crucial in the production of Regeneron’s life-saving products. As a Senior IT Applications Analyst a typical day might include the following: Ensuring the Labware application remains in a compliant state by processing change control requests for system configuration, including requirement and/or design specifications, test plans, technical evaluation and quality risk assessments. Collaborating closely with laboratory personnel to set priorities and support business-critical projects. Initiating, authoring, and reviewing documents such as Change Controls, investigations, deviations, risk assessments, impact statements and corrective/prevention action plans. Participating in, leading, or authoring investigations and root cause analysis for department issues of non-compliance. Drafting, approving and following relevant system software SOPs and policies Representing the team as the Labware LIMS Subject Matter Expert during technical and planning meetings. Ensuring system integration with other applications as required (e.g. Waters Nugenesis ELN, Biovia ELN, Oracle OPM, Werum MES). Ensuring appropriate user access including control access to software systems; by configuring user roles, user groups and security settings. Supporting system validation and qualification efforts. Providing leadership including code and configuration reviews, coaching, and assistance to junior team members. Building, maintaining, and troubleshooting Labware Visual Workflows and LIMS Basic. This Role Might Be For You If You Enjoy working independently, while at the same time being part of a collaborative, engaged team intent on crafting and delivering quality applications Desire to be a catalyst within an organization delivering cutting-edge medicines Have an expertise in administration and configuration of Labware LIMS software Enjoy the challenge of learning new systems and applications Are familiar with regulatory and quality policies, procedures and documentation methods, ideally in cGMP biotech/pharma operations Enjoy helping end-users solve problems and are committed to finding innovative solutions to laboratory testing challenges Have some project management experience Possess stellar organizational skills Appreciate the importance of Quality Control in the laboratory and IT settings To Be Considered For This Role You Must Hold A BS/BA in Science, Information Systems or other relevant field and: Senior Analyst - 5+ years of experience with Labware LIMS in a GXP industry. Principal IT Applications Analyst. - 8+ years of experience in a pharmaceutical setting highly preferred. Level will be determined based on qualifications relevant to the role. Reporting to the Head of GPS Standards Training & Intelligence, this position is responsible for establishing and maintaining procedures and policies consistent with global regulatory requirements and industry standards; and assuring training on those procedures and policies is conducted, throughout the GPS department and globally. The responsibilities of this job are foundational in the creation and maintenance of the Pharmacovigilance (PV) Quality Management System that is essential in enabling the department to align with regulatory PV requirements in all relevant territories worldwide, and to operate efficiently and effectively in alignment with established industry practices. This position serves as a central interface for GPS with partnering functions such as Industrial Operations and Product Supply Quality Assurance (Complaints), Legal, Procurement, and Commercial. A Typical Day In This Position Might Consist Of Communications, guidance and supplementary training materials/support to complement the processes Supply a training program for all individuals within the GPS department, and outside the department if they are involved in a regulated GVP activity Responsible, in partnership with GPS and other business area subject matter experts, to: review all procedures periodically to ensure they continue to correctly describe the GPS activities followed and monitor compliance with required training, and address non-compliance by working with line management. Lead, or participate in, as requested, initiatives to continuously enhance the effectiveness and efficiency of GPS processes by gathering, analyzing and communicating relevant metrics on the performance of the processes Collaborated closely regularly with partners (e.g., GD Quality, GD Process & Procedures) on standards for procedures and related documents, and the management of deviations Partner with GD Quality, GPS Quality and Compliance and other relevant GPS lines to lead quality events and CAPAs for GPS Standards and Training. Provide support to other GPS functions as needed to address process-related quality events/CAPAs. Handle assignment of adverse event (AE) & product complaint (PC) training globally to vendors This Role Might Be For You If Bachelor’s degree is required. Education in the life sciences is a strong plus. 5+ years of relevant experience. Proven experience in Pharmacovigilance/Drug Safety, Regulatory Affairs or Quality Assurance in the pharmaceutical/biotech industry Experience with Pharmacovigilance/Drug Safety regulations and PV Quality Management Systems Track record of successful project management relevant to quality management #GDPSJobs Does this sound like you? jobTitle: Sr Manager, Precision Medicine Operations Lead (CDx)
jobDescription: As a Senior Manager, working with our Companion Diagnostics Strategy Leads and Precision Medicine we provide operational oversight and execution of Regeneron’s CDx portfolio. You will support and deliver on building an operational framework supporting our CDx function and portfolio. You are expected to work closely with clinical program and study teams, external collaboration partners/IVD Sponsors and central and testing laboratories to facilitate all operational aspects of CDx projects from initial strategy, through study conduct, sample management and testing, to launch. As a Senior Manager, a typical day may include the following: CDx Operations Function Developing, building and implementing processes and tools to support and lead the Companion Diagnostics function to ensure quality, efficient and timely delivery Building and maintaining a project planning model supporting CDx delivery in alignment with other key functions and partners, both internal and external to Regeneron CDx Project Execution Drive the execution of the CDx strategy in parallel to the corresponding Regeneron clinical drug development programs and studies Coordinate CDx activities in partnership with the CDx Strategy Lead and coordinating broader clinical study team / functional areas Clinical Drug Development Program And Study Team Involvement Serve as an active member of clinical study teams to ensure CDx planning is in line with clinical study plans and to ensure study teams are informed of CDx activities, status, budget and timelines Support CDx Strategy Lead and CDx management with information relevant to driving program strategy in participation with Strategic Program Teams Stakeholder Management & External Collaborations Manage and integrate with team members from functional groups across Regeneron using data driven approaches Partner with laboratory operations team to align on biomarker testing and sample oversight activities This May Be For You If You Want to have an impact on patient lives Enjoy working in a “rapid response” environment Can lead by influence in a cross-functional matrix team Want to work with hard-working scientist and clinicians To be considered for this you should have a minimum of 7 years experience in clinical trials, drug development, and/or laboratory and sample management. Extensive project management experience including budget management, vendor engagement is required. Knowledge of drug development, clinical trial execution (CDx experience is a plus). Experience managing biomarker and/or CDx assay development operations in early and late stage clinical development programs is preferred. Strong communication and presentation skills are required. Proficient in business technology tools and understanding data (e.g. Microsoft Teams, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.). #GDECDJobs Does this sound like you? The Sr. Manager of Regulatory Labeling manages the development, review, approval, and maintenance of the Company Core Data Sheets (CCDS), USPI, EU SmPC and Rest of World (RoW) labeling. Provides labeling expertise to the Labeling Working Group and other relevant stakeholders, typically carrying out responsibilities with minimal guidance. Leads development of labeling strategies and is responsible for the management of marketed or pipeline products, across the product lifecycle. Job Duties Manages the Regulatory labeling process throughout the product lifecycle. Leads the Labeling Working Group and manages development, review, approval, and maintenance of labeling for CCDS, USPI, EU SmPC, and RoW labeling. Manages complex programs with minimal support from the Labeling Director. Leads development of labeling strategies through interpretation of labeling regulations, guidelines and competitor analyses, and application to product situation. Leads the development of target labeling documents to support the design and analysis plan for clinical trials, with guidance from the Labeling Director. Leads or contributes to discussions on labeling topics at relevant management interactions. Effectively communicates labeling rationales to various levels of management to enable decision making. Provides labeling expertise on complex issues to stakeholders. Anticipates Health Authority (HA) perspectives and broader implications of strategies, proposing alternatives and providing advice to mitigate risk. Communicates consequences to product portfolio. Prepares submission-ready labeling documents. Maintains labeling documents in the electronic document management system and relevant labeling trackers as appropriate. Contributes to the development of the Regulatory Labeling Group through active knowledge sharing andmentoring of junior staff members to build labeling expertise. Monitors worldwide regulation changes pertaining to Labeling regulations and maintains the labeling SOP and work instructions. May be responsible for leading or contributing to various continuous improvement projects. Job Requirements You have in-depth knowledge of worldwide regulations, guidance and review standards, and industry best practices and standards pertaining to labeling. Ability and competencies to rapidly establish therapeutic class working knowledge. You have the capability to contribute to and lead a team You are a strong communication with interpersonal skill to influence others in a positive and effective manner to build consensus You can deliver results in a dynamic environment with a high level of professionalism and attention to detail or thoroughness. You are able manage staff and develop talent by mentoring them through increased levels of responsibility To be considered for the opportunity, we expect you to have at 10 regulatory affairs, preferably within labelin. You have a scientific degree (i.e., Masters, PharmD, Ph.D) or at minimum, a Bachelor's degree (BS) from an accredited college or university in Life Sciences. We would appreciate if the individual has a PMP certificate #GDRAJOBS Does this sound like you? Apply now to take your first steps toward living the Regeneron Way! We have an inclusive and diverse culture that provides comprehensive benefits including health and wellness programs, fitness centers and equity awards, annual bonuses, and paid time off for eligible employees at all levels! jobTitle: Sr Manager, Veterinary Services & Vivarium Operations
jobDescription: We are seeking a motivated Senior Manager to join the Veterinary Services and Vivarium Operations group. You will assist the Senior Vivarium Management in administering a program of animal care and use for research and/or production facilities. We hope you are excited by the opportunity to play your part in expanding our toolbox and technologies in order to provide the most relevant models for human disease research. As a Senior Manager, a Typical Day Might Include Working with the Director of Veterinary Services/Vivarium Operations and Senior Vivarium Management to provide oversight on the activities of animal husbandry staff and the vivarium operations. Ensuring the facility follows all applicable regulations, guidelines and standards that relate to animal care and use (e.g., USDA, NYSDOH, AAALAC). Problem solving with animal production and research groups in cases of unexpected outcomes and ensuring compliance within Regeneron policies and guidelines. Leading a program of disease detection and surveillance, prevention, diagnosis, treatment, and resolution. Providing support for activities of the IACUC, including protocol review, program review and facility inspections. Participating in a rotating weekly on-call schedule to provide after-hours, holidays, and weekend veterinary coverage. Participating in and supporting the Laboratory Animal Medicine Training Program. Performing research-related clinical and surgical procedures with rodent models. Providing input and writing initial performance evaluations for assigned staff and reviews as a secondary manager for assigned staff’s direct reports. Assisting with training programs for animal husbandry staff, veterinary technicians, and research staff working with animals. Reviewing SOPs, guidelines, and policies. This Role May Be For You If You enjoy collaborating on the development of animal care facilities processes and policies. You have a highly developed drive toward innovation and participate in the improvement of processes. You can participate in decision making for health monitoring programs. To be considered for this role you must have a DVM or VMD or equivalent degree, as well as ACLAM Board certification (or working towards). We need someone with 3-5 years of experience in a related field, and a minimum of 2 years of relevant experience with rodents and rabbits in a laboratory setting. We are looking for someone with extensive knowledge and technical proficiency in standard laboratory animal techniques and of laboratory animal medicine. Must have knowledge of regulations regarding the proper standards of animal care and use in a research environment. Shares after-hours and weekend/holiday emergency on-call services with management and veterinary staff. Does this sound like you? Apply now to take your first steps toward living the Regeneron Way! jobTitle: Sr Manager, Workday Service Delivery Management
jobDescription: The Workday Service Delivery Manager is a key member of the G&A IT Operations Services and Delivery Organization that enables the delivery of a high-quality service experience to our end-users and will have direct contact with our key internal & external collaborators. This position will be responsible for the day-to-day operational support of the Workday HCM solution and managing our Workday MSP. You will be leading multiple aspects of the platform delivery including; setting expectations with the business and driving IT teams to achieve those expectations with a high standard of excellence. This is a new role that will directly impact our Leaders, Employees and Regeneron's human capital capabilities for years to come. As a Services Delivery Manager a typical day may include: Leading the Managed Services Provider in providing technical and functional support for the Workday HCM solution Maintain successful operational service support functions in support of operational “Run” activities related to the Workday HCM solution. This includes operational support of integrations between Workday and Oracle eBS and to other satellite systems. Owner of the escalation process and activities to drive resolution for major incidents, effectively communicating and ensuring completion of post incident review (root cause analysis). Ensuring methodologies and procedures are in place to support service delivery and compliant with SOX requirements. Co-ordinate activities with other IT teams and their Managed Service Providers (e.g. SSO issues) Use business knowledge and expertise to find opportunities for process improvements. Ensure effective monitoring of service by generating daily, weekly, monthly metrics for incidents, service requests and changes to the Workday solution. Provide regular and accurate management reporting on IT Service performance. This Role May Be For You If You Have Strong knowledge of Workday HCM modules and leadership capabilities around leading Operational teams The ability to build positive relationships with the Product teams, etc. to ensure that solutions are appropriately prioritized, implemented and transitioned efficiently to operations. Can ensure the highest level of service availability and efficiency consistent with enterprise goals and constraints. An eye for Service Improvement Plans and can drive continuous improvement initiatives to increase efficiency, availability, and productivity across functional and technical teams. High accountability for driving success from a technology standpoint Good problem solving, technical writing and verbal communication skills To be considered for this role you must possess a Bachelors degree with a minimum of 8 years of related experience implementing and supporting complex HCM solutions in a large, matrixed enterprise (experience within the pharmaceutical industry is a plus). 5+ years of global experience implementing and supporting Workday HCM applications. Experience with Workday Integration solutions using EIB, Core Connectors, Cloud Connect, Workday Studio and BIRT reporting. Ability to help resolve integration issues requiring in depth expertise in the Workday and Boomi solution. Does this sound like you? We are currently looking to fill a Sr Manufacturing Planning Specialist position. Regeneron successfully manufactures a range of biopharmaceuticals for patients worldwide, including our approved therapeutic proteins and those involved in clinical studies. Our Sr Manufacturing Planning Specialist performs tasks related to the planning of global manufacturing operations, tracking and analysis of production metrics, coordination of non-manufacturing activities such as maintenance and validation, and analyzing multi-site production capacity. As a Sr Manufacturing Planning Specialist, a typical day might include the following: Translates demand forecasts into production schedules Creates production schedules for multiple products in efficient manner with minimum delays Recommends solutions to address issues when they arise to minimize disruption to the production schedule Assist in planning cross-functional activities with both manufacturing and non-manufacturing groups Participates in resource planning activities to understand where and when the department needs to grow Acts as the point of contact for production data to several cross functional departments such as supply chain, finance, and QA disposition Generates and maintains daily manufacturing operations and resource schedules Develops effective shift and training schedules Analyzes and determines training needs related to personnel and production schedules. Performs data collection related to process durations, operator efficiencies, and characterizing scheduling delays Creates data models using spreadsheets, code, or other relevant methods Assists in improving communication between different shifts, process areas, and levels of the organization. This Role Might Be For You If You Have Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate information with attention to detail and accuracy Background in data analytics or relevant data science field Experience working both independently as an original thinker and in a team setting Ability to exhibit a degree of ingenuity, creativity and resourcefulness in evolving and ambiguous Strong communication skills and the ability to present complex data To be considered for the Sr Manufacturing Planning Specialist position, you have: BS/BA in Science, Engineering, or a related field and 5+ years of relevant experience To be considered for the Principal Manufacturing Planning Specialist position, you have: BS/BA in Science, Engineering, or a related field and 8+ years of relevant experience Relevant biotech manufacturing or supply chain experience is a plus, MS in a related field is preferred. Level is determined based on qualifications relevant to the role. Does this sound like you? Apply now to take your first steps toward living the Regeneron Way! The Senior Medical Writer will be responsible for supervising their own writing projects, and for knowing, understanding, and ensuring adherence to regulatory guidelines and department document standards. We expect them to ensure maintenance of document standardization through use of model documents/templates and appropriate peer review. We assume the writer to review documents related to the CSR, such as the Statistical Analysis Plan and draft tables, figures and listings, and ensuring that they provide the appropriate information/data for a CSR. The Senior Medical Writer will be responsible for liaising with the appropriate matrixed team members to shape and review content of documents, and to follow up with other functional groups for materials needed for document completion. The individual in this position will work independently writing CSRs, CSPs, CSP amendments, and ICFs in a variety of therapeutic areas. Training on Clinical Summaries and other regulatory documents may be provided. In this role, a typical day might include the following: Working with the clinical team, the Senior Medical Writer will be responsible for writing Clinical Study Protocols, Clinical Study Protocol Amendments, Clinical Study Reports, Informed Consent Forms, and Patient Safety Narratives. Opportunities to write or contribute to other Regulatory documents such as Clinical Summaries and Briefing Documents may be provided. Be able to identify the correct parties for a document content decision, and if a discussion is faltering, bring the discussion back on track with minimal fuss. Follow a discussion to its conclusion, synthesize the message, and present clear accurate prose quickly. Manage processes and organize priorities; Solve problems; Foster collaboration to resolve conflict Familiarity with ICH GCP guidelines for informed consent considered a plus This Role Might Be For You If You have the ability to work independently You can provide appropriate input on others’ documents, including review of key contributing documents, such as the SAP You are able to proactively identify and manage projects, requiring some but not significant guidance You can comprehend key points of meetings and interactions, and follows up when necessary To be consider, we expect you to have 5+ years of medical writing experience along with a bachelors degree. We expect the medical writer to have written CSRs, clinical protocols, clinical protocol amendments, patient narratives, and ICFs. #GDRAJobs Does this sound like you? The Senior Manager, Global Product & Pipeline Communications, will help to drive awareness, understanding and appreciation of Regeneron’s products and pipeline in key markets outside of the U.S. – with an initial focus on oncology and hematology. Reporting to the head of Product & Pipeline Communications, this person will work closely with Corporate Communications and the Oncology/Hematology Communications team to shape, build and operationalize ex-U.S. communications at Regeneron in support of product and pipeline business needs. This role requires a strong background in product and/or pipeline communications. Global experience, as well as oncology and/or hematology experience, will be looked upon favorably. In addition, the Senior Manager should have the ability to think cross-functionally and ‘company first’ as we shape and protect Regeneron’s corporate reputation beyond the U.S. A Typical Day Might Include Working in lockstep with Corporate Communications to shape and establish an operating model for best-in-class, global product and pipeline communications: Help define and synergize roles, responsibilities and ways of working cross-functionally – including among Product & Pipeline Communications, Corporate Communications, Internal Communications, Advocacy, Commercial and Medical Affairs. Determine communications obligations and responsibilities in ex-U.S. countries Regeneron operates in and establish processes to ensure we meet them. Develop an expertise on, and guidelines for, best practices and requirements for product and pipeline communications in key ex-U.S. markets. Help plan for future global Product & Pipeline Communications needs, including infrastructure, technology and human resources. Driving awareness, understanding and appreciation of Regeneron’s oncology/hematology pipeline in key ex-U.S. markets in collaboration with the Oncology/Hematology Communications team. As a global product & pipeline communications expert, this would include: Leading planning and execution for ex-U.S. product and pipeline milestones, including developing press releases and other supporting external and internal communications materials. Creating cross-functional teams to support ex-U.S. product and pipeline communications. Establishing effective working relationships with the local affiliates of our global partners and collaborators. Organizing and executing communications programs to support business needs in key ex-U.S. markets, aligned with Commercial and Global Development KPIs. Supporting the development of product and pipeline content for in-country corporate websites and other digital channels. Ensuring communications compliance with local legal and regulatory requirements. Managing global agencies supporting ex-U.S. product and pipeline communications. Helping establish relationships with news media in key ex-U.S. regions and markets: Develop guidelines for working compliantly with ex-U.S. news media, including opportunities and limitations. Identify ex-U.S. news media who are relevant stakeholders for product and pipeline communications programs, and foster relationships with them. Serve as a spokesperson for ex-U.S. news media, when needed. The expected work will be conducted from the U.S., but may require global travel. Over time, the role may evolve to include oversight of global product and pipeline communications across multiple therapeutic areas, in addition to oncology and hematology. You will be supported by internal working groups and external resources to ensure deep knowledge of local regulations, stakeholders and culture. Required skills include strategic planning, creative planning/execution, media relations, issues management, content creation, social media/digital execution and measurement. Familiarity with patient advocacy and corporate responsibility practices will also add value. This Role Might Be For You If Have A Bachelor’s Degree: minimum of 8 years of relevant communications experience, including proven expertise in product and/or pipeline communications, ideally at one or more publicly-listed biotech or pharmaceutical companies. Global experience, as well as oncology and/or hematology experience – both of which would be looked upon favorably. An ability to work as an independent, self-starter with urgency and a results-oriented mindset. An adeptness in creating partnerships and working collaboratively across a highly matrixed organization to meet shared objectives and goals. Confidence to share new ideas, and an ability to influence partners, inspire agency partners and manage associated resources and budget. Detail-oriented, with an ability to manage and prioritize multiple tasks and project. An ability to proactively address highly complex problems and quickly recommend sound and viable solutions, often with incomplete information and in a fast-moving and fast-growing organization. Experience leading creative PR programming directed towards consumers and healthcare professionals that has measurable impact. Outstanding verbal and written communication and presentation skills, with comfort and proficiency in translating complicated science into meaningful messages for different external audiences. Relevant knowledge and experience creating content in integrated digital media formats (intranets, video, mobile, etc.) Passion for science and patient impact, and a curiosity and desire to learn The successful candidate will join a high-performing Corporate Communications & Citizenship team, which thinks strategically and executes at a high level to support our fast-growing company and unique culture -- where colleagues are passionate about their work and our mission to bring important new medicines to patients in need. The team is focused on strengthening Regeneron’s reputation by developing strategies and programs that (1) distinguish our science, medicines and patient focus, (2) sustain culture and drive employee engagement, and (3) advance and differentiate our corporate responsibility commitments. This role supports the Development Portfolio Analytics team to develop, refine and maintain robust portfolio forecasting and reporting capabilities aiding in enterprise-wide portfolio decision making. The selected candidate will ensure processes & tools are fit for purpose and scalable as the portfolio grows. Partnering with key leadership working cross functionally across Global Development and other enterprise functions including Program Management and Finance, to support the development of KPI/metrics. Assess and provide insights to the health of the portfolio including time, budget and quality at the program and portfolio level. The role will also have a focus on continuous improvement of insight generation and data analysis across the portfolio by chipping in to the design of data infrastructure to support high quality reporting capabilities. In this role, a typical day might include the following: Maintain and enhance the project management data model associated with our Project Web App (PWA) instance and with mentorship, build enhancements and connectivity to new data sets, as they become available, in an efficient manner that follows industry standards and guidelines. Support efforts around the creation of an integrated data management. Support the team within Development Analytics and Data Science (DADS), and cross-functionally with other departments, around key existing/new applications used for the collection and maintenance of core data assets. Ensures portfolio level project management effectiveness through effective system utilization, accurate data aggregation, and valuable reporting and dashboards Provide guidance and a strategy of “mine once and reuse”. An instrumental contributor in the stewardship of how data is clearly defined and adhered to by all departments and ensure there is overall strategy for the connectivity of company data to support vertical and horizontal integration across functional areas and organization. Support efforts for stakeholder systems to help define data management strategy in line with a company-wide perspective. Build, handle, and run core Development Portfolio dashboards, with the help of manager. Be a part of efforts to increase usage, help create tools to manage data accuracy, and build reporting capabilities into key presentations. Communicate insights and recommendations to senior leadership. This Role Might Be For You If You have a proven track record in data visualization or data modeling in the clinical or research space. Experience in a discipline data modeling and knowledge management. A proven track record giving to the development of concepts, techniques and standards. To be considered for this opportunity you must possess a Bachelors degree with a minimum of 10 years’ of validated experience in an analytics role. An MBA with 5 + years’ experience, preferred. Proficient in techniques with relevant software: QlikView, Qlik Sense, SQL, SharePoint, Excel, PowerPoint, Word, etc. in addition to experience working within shared work environments #GDDOPMJobs Does this sound like you? jobTitle: Sr Mgr Regulatory Affairs Business Operations
jobDescription: We expect the Senior Manager, Regulatory Affairs Business Operations to be a team member who can combine financial analysis, vendor / contract management, continuous improvement and project management experience. We believe they will play a significant role in the delivery of the Regulatory Affairs Business Operations mission, goals, and objectives. In this role, a typical day might include the following: Build collaborative relationships with Reg. Affairs Functional Leaders to identify, analyze and execute Business process improvements. Partner with Finance, Accounting, and Procurement to ensure regulatory operational challenges are resolved Build organizational awareness by strategically connecting all areas of the Reg. Affiars organization that are impacted when challenges arise. Lead cross-functional projects and initiatives by anticipating potential issues and influencing key stakeholders Develop and monitor financial and operational metrics to support business decision-making Lead Project and Change Management Activities for various Reg Affairs Business Improvement activities. Manage discussions with Space Planning to ensure Regulatory Affairs space needs are resourced appropriately. Partner with Procurement to facilitate the Qualification and On-Boarding of new Reg. Affairs Vendors This Role Might Be For You If You have the ability to develop tactical project plans and timelines and lead teams to complete project milestones and objectives on time and within budget You bring strong communication and program management skills You can identify, manage and mitigate operational risk You are unrelenting dedication to delivering results To be considered for the opportunity, we expect you to have at 10 years of relevant and progressive experience in Business Operations. Regeneron is currently looking for a Sr. Microbiologist to join our Quality Control (QC) Validation team. This role is responsible for QC microbiological aspects of cGMP compliance, testing and investigations and will support our manufacturing operations, including our new Fill Finish Facility. As a Sr. Microbiologist, a typical day might include the following: Responsible for QC microbiological aspects of cGMP compliance and testing Assist Contract Labs with setting up studies for Disinfectant efficacy and act as a reviewer for the final summary report Assist manufacturing personnel in the identification of microbiological root cause analysis and provide technical advice as needed Participate in the investigation and review of alert and action limit investigations as needed and implements corrective action as appropriate Participate in cleaning and process validation activities involving microbiology as needed Participate in the investigation of microbiological product OOS results and DNF as needed Contribute to the preparation of technical proposals, amendments, reports and memoranda Contribute toward creating and revising microbiological SOPs Assist in scheduling of M/C and post incursion supervising procedures with follow-up responsibility to provide test results Assist in the review of EM and product release data This Role Might Be For You If You Have experience with environmental monitoring, endotoxin testing, bioburden testing, aseptic techniques and sterility testing Are able to communicate with transparency Continuously drive to improve processes for improved performance Have experience working in a GMP environment Are able to interpret data and develop improvement plan Initiate the development of leadership skills by providing training and guidance to others Anticipate and plan for change Demonstrate analytical skills through critical problem-solving Participate in projects in addition to daily responsibilities To be considered for the Sr. Microbiologist you must have a BS/BA in Biochemistry, Chemistry or Biology or related field and 2+ years of relevant experience, preferably in the pharmaceuticals or biotechnology industries. Experience with pharmaceutical documentation practices and demonstrated leadership experience is preferred. #Hybrid Does this sound like you? Preclinical Operations (PCO) is seeking a Senior Preclinical Operations Associate to join the team. With guidance, this team member would provide operational Project Management (PM) support to Preclinical Development (PCD) and Drug Safety & Pharmacometrics (DSP) functions and cross-functional teams on assigned projects. A Typical Day In This Role With guidance, provides operational PM support to PCD/DSP cross-functional teams for assigned programs . With guidance, provide primarily operational (but at times strategic) PM support to PCD and/or DSP function(s) work assignments and/or portions of projects where specialized area knowledge or experience is needed. Coordinates development and alignment of PCD/DSP integrated cross-functional project deliverables, plans, timelines, resources, and budget forecasts to align with the overall project plan. Facilitates effective execution of project plan to enable completion of PCD/DSP activities within agreed timeline, quality, and budgetary constraints. Effectively monitors and communicates progress and variance against the approved plan. Effectively communicates and facilitates resolution of risks, issues, and obstacles. Ensures effective, accurate, and timely communications across PCD, DSP, and Project Teams. Ensures that PCO systems are updated with timely, accurate, and relevant information. Proposes ideas on areas for process improvement and with guidance, facilitates development and implementation of solutions, tools, or mechanisms to resolve the issue. This Role May Be For You If You enjoy working in a highly collaborative setting You have the ability to multi-task, in order to drive multiple projects to completion Typically requires a minimum of 5+ years of related R&D operational support and/or PM experience in the drug development/pharmaceutical industry. Ability to coordinate and facilitate development, alignment, and execution of project plans and budget forecasts for the assigned programs and/or function(s). Does this sound like you? We are looking for a Sr. Principal Information Security who will help craft IT data privacy and protection strategy. The Privacy Steward key role is to supervise, report, advise, and set actions to ensure that Regeneron IT is fully aligned with Regeneron’s policies relating to Privacy. Privacy Steward acts as subject matter authorities for any change program and business transformation with the IT technology team ensure privacy is included by design. They will act as a role model, demonstrating active leadership and communication on privacy topics, initiatives and developments in both law and regulation. As a subject matter authority, they needs to be able to communicate and operate at senior management level, working closely with Data Privacy, Legal, Compliance, Intellectual Properties, and Information Security. The Privacy Steward is responsible for embedding and strengthening privacy controls, working with Risk teams to develop effective monitoring and testing of these controls within established risk frameworks and implementation of any residual post-GDPR actions. The role holder has end to end responsibility for all aspects of privacy and the operating model including definition, execution, establishing and reporting on Key Process Indicators or Key Risk Indicators. In addition, oversight support for Information Security Policy management will be included in the role. Candidates must have a proven track record of providing sound and practical privacy and compliance advice and must be able to demonstrate an ability to communicate and influence others regarding data security matters. They should also have prior experience in policy management. In this role, a typical day might include the following: Attend and actively participate in Privacy Council Meetings (monthly cadence) Serve as Information Technologies Privacy steward and liaison between IT and Legal departments for privacy and risk related issues. Ensure Regeneron Global Privacy Policy and IT Record Retention Schedule are operationalized. Lead as a subject matter expert on privacy, intellectual property, data retention issues within IT and provide consultative support. Advance privacy/security incidents to the Data Privacy Office and Intellectual Property teams. Liaise with IT project owners to complete privacy assessments (PIAs, DPIAs) and ensure mitigations are actioned by the project owner. Provide performance and risk metrics to department leadership related to privacy and application risk assessments. Provide oversight for Information Security Policy management Provide complimentary support for Risk Management and compliance functions This Job Might Be For You If You have demonstrated leadership and partnering skills, plus excellent verbal, and written communication skills, with focus on advising, influencing, and relationship building. You look for cooperation and collaboration between various levels of the organization to implement privacy and data security programs. You thrive in a fast-paced environment and have the business sense to identify and communicate privacy, legal, and data protection issues while proposing practical solutions in line with business objectives. You have a demonstrated passion for making things better and building resourceful solutions. To be considered for the Sr. Principal Information Security you must have Bachelor’s degree and a minimum twelve years of relevant experience. CIPP or other privacy related certifications highly desired. Solid understanding of international privacy and data protection laws and proven track record to interact with Legal Department. Experience or familiarity with conducting privacy impact assessments in diverse operational environments. Significant understanding and proven experience in a Risk Management function. Strong project management and coordination skills with validated ability to meet deadlines, prioritize assignments, and lead multiple projects. Motivated self-starter with strong attention to detail. Candidates with experience within the pharmaceutical industry will be given preferential consideration. #LIHybrid Level Commensurate With Experience And Qualifications. Does this sound like you? jobTitle: Sr. R&D Specialist, New Technologies (Lipid Nanoparticles)
jobDescription: We are seeking a highly motivated Sr R&D Specialist in the New Technology Group within the Formulation Development Group (FDG) to support activities in building capabilities for Lipid nanoparticle-based delivery platforms within FDG and support the development of therapeutic modalities with focus on RNA-based therapeutics. The New Technology Group in FDG supports development of multiple novel technologies, platforms & modalities and impacts key therapeutic areas such as Ophthalmology, Infectious diseases, Oncology, and Immunology. Complex drug products as such tend to present unique challenges that requires additional and unique product development efforts. Additionally, these research and development efforts in the field of genetic medicine also require relevant expertise to support the required technical & platform development efforts of the newly established as well as evolving strategies. The position will be to supporting successful Lipid Nanoparticle technology development efforts for novel modalities (LNP, RNA therapeutics) and ensure optimal product quality in collaboration with potential internal (FDG, Ophthalmology) and external collaborators. A Day As a Sr. Specialist Looks Like Support and assist in formulation, characterization, and stability activities for LNP delivery of nucleic acid therapeutics for different routes of administration (IV, IM, SC, SCS etc.) Provide key support to build formulation capabilities for lipid nanoparticles in FDG that would be used as a platform to deliver RNA therapeutics Work and collaborate in multi-functional teams to support formulation, process development, toxicology, and PK/PD studies Collect, process and analyze data, and participate in data presentations to the management Assist in drafting and reviewing technical protocols/reports Apply strong problem-solving skills and flexible to changing priorities as required Document experiments, results, and findings in electronic laboratory notebook. Complete project plans supported by strong scientific rationales and technical approaches, while cognizant of project priorities, and deliverables (e.g. memos, reports) and timeouts. This Role May Be For You If Strong understanding and hands-on lab experience in evaluation of formulation and drug delivery for proteins and oligonucleotides, nanoparticulate systems, liposome drug delivery systems etc. Hands-on experience in HPLC/UPLC, UV-Vis, fluorescence, viscometer, chromatography, electrophoresis (cIEF, MCE-SDS, SDS-PAGE), TEM, DLS, Zetaview and imaging/microscopy techniques (MFI, SEM) and other analytical techniques relevant for LNP & RNA characterization is preferred. Understanding of statistical approaches and software packages for data analysis and design of experiments (DOE) for analytical method development and/or formulation development. Strong initiative and drive to complete ambitious tasks and proactively learn new technologies related to Lipid Nanoparticle Formulation Development. To be considered for this role, we require a BS with 8+ years or MS with 5+ years of industry experience in Pharmaceutics, Biotechnology, Biomedical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Biology or related is preferred. Background in nanoparticle-based formulation development & relevant analytical characterization is preferred.. Experience in general biologics product development including understanding of formulation, process and characterization fundamentals is desired. Consistent record in handling a variety of analytical techniques preferred. #RDFormulations Does this sound like you? Apply now to take your first steps toward living the Regeneron Way! jobTitle: Sr Research Operations Associate, VI Next
jobDescription: We are seeking a highly motivated individual to join our Research Operations group to support DNA Core, Automation, Molecular Profiling Data Science, and the Bioinformatic Core Services. The candidate will be operating as a liaison across multiple TFA’s and Tech Centers as well as internal collaborators, external customers, research IT, legal and contract department. As a Senior Operations Associate, a typical day might include: Facilitating coordination between various internal groups such as DNA Core, Automation, TFA’s, Molecular Profiling Data Science, BiCS and R-IT. Developing and implementing processes to improve efficiency in workflow. Identifying and understanding key pain-points in the pipeline and developing various solutions to improve efficiency. Fostering strong working relationships with key stakeholders on project and/or program teams and across departments. Coordinating scientific analysis of clinical and pre-clinical samples, as well as manage a tracking system for internal and external collaborator samples entering the Molecular Profiling group. Gathering and compiling scientific data for submission to support patent filings and contract for various groups. Overseeing operational management of multiple databases. Maintaining multiple projects and priorities while understanding potential down-stream impacts on other functions and teams. This Role Might Be For You If You have the ability to work well in a team. You possess excellent oral and written communication skills. You have strong organizational and timely record-keeping skills. You have the ability to perform work with a high degree of attention to detail. You have the flexibility to adapt to a rapidly evolving research environment is highly desirable. You are a creative and collaborative problem solver. To be considered for this role, you must possess a bachelor’s or master’s degree with 3 to 5 years of relevant experience. The ideal person has previous lab experience that they can leverage in this role. You should have a background in Biology, knowledge of computer packages, technical skills, programing skills, Confluence, Jira, IDEAS Database, SLIMS, SharePoint, Microsoft Office, Outlook, FileMaker Pro. You should also be proficient in database management. You should ideally have a process and programing background to support developing and managing a tracking system to facilitate coordination of submission and analysis of samples of clinical and pre-clinical, as well as internal and external collaborator samples. jobTitle: Sr. Staff Scientist, New Technologies (Lipid Nanoparticles)
jobDescription: We are seeking a highly motivated Sr Staff Scientist in the New Technology Group within the Formulation Development Group (FDG) of Regeneron Pharmaceutical Inc. The New Technology Group in FDG supports development of novel technologies, platforms & modalities and impacts key therapeutic areas such as ophthalmology, infectious diseases, oncology, and immunology. The Sr. Staff Scientist provides scientific direction, strategy, and leadership for product development activities on LNP-based technology build initiatives within the FDG. We develop R&D efforts in the field of genetic medicine also requiring expertise to support the required technical & platform development efforts of the newly established as well as evolving strategies. The position is essential to leading successful product development efforts for novel modalities (LNP, RNA therapeutics) and ensure efficient product quality in collaboration with internal and external teams A Typical Day May Look Like Lead a team, guide and advise on capability, technology development & knowledge build for lipid nanoparticle-based (LNP) delivery platforms within FDG as well as on the development of diverse therapeutic modalities with focus on RNA-based therapeutics. Will be experienced in LNP-based product development projects & possess an in-depth understanding of CMC requirements relevant to nucleic acid-based LNP drug product development, and general biologics' development. Be the SME and provide strategic & technical representation in cross functional settings for formulation & processes with RNA- and nanoparticle-based modalities Will effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams to coordinate the product development & characterization of LNP-RNA formulations. You will collaborate with these teams with a vision on readiness for any preclinical/clinical development of LNP-based drug products. Will ensure strong strategic partnership & communication with colleagues from Regeneron Genetic Medicines, Therapeutic Focus Areas, Research groups, Pre-clinical toxicology, Drug Product & Drug Substance Manufacturing, Project Management, Regulatory Sciences, Quality, Business Development, Finance and Marketing. You are responsible for strategic leadership and advice on effective evaluation and characterization of novel formulations/processes & components, delivery technologies & analytical tools in support of therapeutic modalities including (but not limited to) RNA-based therapeutics & nanoparticle modalities. Will supervise design of robust and effective experimentation, development of novel characterization tools, data analysis, interpretation, and summary of the same toward effective conclusion. Will layout, review and execution of project plans supported by strong scientific rationales and technical approaches & will be an effective communicator. Will be cognizant of project priorities, deliverables (e.g. memos, reports) and timelines. Will participate in scientific conferences and forums to gain information about novel technologies with focus on RNA-based therapeutics. Will demonstrate scientific excellence through reports, publications and patents. Will be proactive in generating IP and related documentation and collaborate with Regeneron’s legal teams This Role May Be For You If You have project leadership & industry knowledge and experience in LNP-based drug product development & delivery technologies is required. You have knowledge in general biologics and oligonucleotides product development including understanding of formulation, process and characterization fundamentals across various relevant modalities (e.g. mAbs, fusion proteins, RNA) and delivery forms. Proven ability to think creatively and obtain solutions to complex and diverse problems. Proven record of creative, productive, and insightful analysis and achievement. Proven interpersonal and leadership skills and ability to influence others to achieve results. To be considered, you must have a PhD in Pharmaceutics, Biotechnology, Biomedical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Biology or related field with a strong background in Lipid Nanoparticle-based (LNP) product development and 6+ years' industry experience. Must have prior experience leading a staff of scientists. Does this sound like you? Apply now to take your first steps toward living the Regeneron Way! We seek a dedicated Staff Engineer to join the Preclinical Manufacturing & Process Development group (PMPD). You will lead the group responsible for developing the membrane steps in the purification train of late-stage manufacturing process. The Purification Development (PD) group in PMPD is responsible for developing GMP-ready, phase-appropriate manufacturing processes for all protein-based therapeutics in Regeneron's growing pipeline. We hope you are excited by the opportunity to lead the development of membrane steps in our commercially enabling manufacturing processes leveraging Quality by Design approaches. As a Process Development Engineer, a typical day might include the following: Acting as an established authority in membrane-based separation techniques who demonstrates scientific savvy across Regeneron, proactively identifies improvement opportunities, and determines corresponding strategies for improvements. Leading technology development activities, getting results, and onboarding new technologies. Mentoring directly or indirectly by leading, guiding, and assisting peers, direct reports, and other PMPD personnel. Maintaining and continuously improving lab operations and data or knowledge management systems within the area of expertise. Anticipating customer needs at an organizational level and proactively shaping internal workflows to meet them. Working with supervisors to prepare and deliver an effective oral presentation in internal and external professional meetings to share multi-functional skills and knowledge. Collaborating with internal and external collaborators, regularly interacting with PMPD Senior Leadership. Contributing to lab equipment maintenance and safety to help create a safe, effective, and efficient working environment. Communicating relevant information to PMPD Senior Staff as a departmental program team representative. This Role Might Be For You If You have strong initiative and aim to complete challenging tasks and learn new technologies. You are excited about the opportunity to lead, coach, and mentor a team of talented process development engineers. You are capable of multi-tasking, working both independently and within a team environment. You have excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills. You can think critically and demonstrate problem-solving skills. To be considered for this opportunity, you must have at least a Bachelor's degree with 7-10 years of industrial experience, a Master's degree with 3-5 years of experience, or a Ph.D. with 0-2 years of experience. Must have experience in protein purification in an industry setting. Experience with statistical design of experiments and quality by design is a plus. Demonstrating innovative thinking by developing ideas, tools, or techniques to solve problems or improve established procedures is a plus. Does this sound like you? We are currently looking to fill a Staff QA Specialist (Filling) position with our Drug Product Quality Assurance team. This position will support Quality Assurance initiatives for a broad range of topics relative to the start-up and operations of a Drug Product facility. This position is an outstanding opportunity to be a member of the QA Internal Drug Product Fill/Finish management team, crafting the QA policies, programs, procedures and projects for a new innovative start-up fill/finish site. This individual contributor role will identify strategic opportunities and solutions, gaining consensus and resolving issues of quality, safety, compliance and efficiency that impact the Fill/Finish platform. This role will also serve as a mentor for junior level team members and develop the Fill/Finish team. Filling Develop and approve filling operation policies, process and procedures Train technical aspects of filling operations to the on-the-floor quality group including observance of interventions and response to atypical events (e.g. glass breakage, holes in isolator gloves) Serve as technical expert for filling tech transfer, start-up operations, sophisticated quality investigations and questions Experience with filling with isolator and RABs Experience with sterilization through VHP and/ or autoclaves This Role May Be For You If You Have experience with facilities start-up operations Understand biologics manufacturing operations Are able to lead cross-functional teams and influence policy Can manage others through influence rather than direct authority Have courage to change and embrace change Have worked with Operations personnel for at least 2-4 years in a project position with growing levels of responsibility Have at least 6 years experience in GMP environment, specifically one or more of the following: pharmaceutical filling, packaging/labeling, assembly, and/or visual inspection. Regeneron is currently looking for a Staff Quality Control (QC) Virology Scientist with a Monday-Friday, 8am-4:30pm schedule. This position handles new virus and mycoplasma method development and improvement, method validation or product sample-matrix validation, test specification management, standard procedure creation or revision, and continuous improvement project management with a focus on developing next generation sequencing technologies in a cGMP compliant manner. Accountable for the technical performance and results of the development team. As a Staff QC Virology Scientist , a typical day might include the following: Develop and implement Next Generation Sequencing technology in a GMP environment. Develop and maintain virus and mycoplasma detection assays (in vitro cell based as well as molecular assays i.e. PCR)—This includes writing study protocols and technical reports. Implement the method validation program —This includes writing lab protocols and validation reports for regulatory filing. Train personnel in basic to sophisticated laboratory and troubleshooting techniques (e.g. PCR methods). Responsible for building a strong team of knowledgeable analysts to perform virus and mycoplasma testing of samples. Evaluate and implement new techniques and technologies in GMP environment (e.g. Third Generation Sequencing). Serve as SME for molecular assay. Provide key leadership, vision, and direction to the development group while providing operation and technical expertise. Ensure safety, cleanliness and compliance. This Role Might Be For You If You enjoy identifying, introducing, and onboarding alternative and rapid technologies applicable to Virology assays and procedures. You like to influence the field of QC-Virology in the pharmaceutical industry and have a continuous improvement mentality. You have the passion to direct a team of capable innovators striven to improve all aspects of routine QC testing and investigational tools. You understand the challenges and constrains of all things GMP and how to navigate this environment. Have experience in crafting, developing, and deploying GMP assays from end-to-end. Have strong analytic skills and a detailed approach to problem solving DV1, DV2 Can drive projects forward within the validation framework at Regeneron. Enjoy leading and mentoring team members, including participating in the growing internship program. To be considered for the Staff QC Virology Scientist you must be willing and able to work Monday-Friday, 8am-4:30pm. For various levels you must have the following: Sr. QC Virology Scientist: PhD in Biochemistry, Chemistry or related field with 2+ years relevant experience including biotech /pharmaceutical industry or GMP supervisory experience Staff QC Virology Scientist: PhD in Biochemistry, Chemistry or related field with 5+ years relevant experience including biotech /pharmaceutical industry or GMP supervisory experience Sr. Staff QC Virology Scientist: PhD in Biochemistry, Chemistry or related field with 8+ years relevant experience including biotech /pharmaceutical industry or GMP supervisory experience Level is determined based on qualifications relevant to the role.
