We are looking for hard-working Scientist to add to the Bioanalytical Science (BAS) team. You will serve as the Principal Investigator to oversee bioanalysis for clinical studies within BAS. Acts as the liaison between BAS and clinical study teams to manage pharmacokinetics (PK), immunogenicity, and biomarker deliverables and timelines for clinical studies. Reviews data, documentation, and sample analysis reports to ensure sample analyses are in compliance with study protocols, SOPs, regulatory guidance, and industry standards. Lead bioanalytical activities outsourced to external partners. A Typical Day Might Include The Following Responsible for the conduct of the bioanalysis portion of clinical studies. Review PK, immunogenicity, and biomarker data from clinical studies to ensure the quality and integrity of data. Prepare and review sample analysis documentation and clinical sample analysis reports. Contributes to regulatory submissions and responses to regulatory inquiries. Review clinical study-related documents including expanded synopses, protocols, amendments, statistical analysis plan, and clinical study reports. Review SOPs, publications, and guidelines to ensure the conduct of bioanalysis is compliant with industry practice and/or regulatory expectations. Develop the bioanalytical strategy, as well as oversee method development, validation, sample analysis, budget, and timeline management of bioanalytical projects outsourced to external partners. This Role Might Be For You If Experience with bioanalytical techniques, e.g., ELISA, ECL, MSD, LC-MS/MS, PCR, flow cytometry, or immunogenicity assays. Experience with writing/reviewing scientific documents, reports, and contributing to regulatory submissions. Strong communication, project management, and interpersonal skills To be considered for this role, you must have PhD in immunology, pharmaceutical sciences, or related field, and a minimum two (2) years of industry experience in a role related to bioanalytical sciences or a similar field. jobTitle: Staff Scientist, Drug Product Process Development (AAV, RNA, gene therapy
jobDescription: We are seeking a highly motivated Staff Scientist in the Process Development (PD) Team within the Formulation Development Group to support our genetics medicine. The PD team supports programs across all stages of clinical development and provides technical leadership towards clinical & commercial drug product PD and technology transfer. We provide technical support towards GMP manufacturing, validation campaigns as well as post-launch activities for drug product. You will lead a motivated team and support process development as a SME for programs, specifically comprised of gene therapy modalities (e.g., AAV, RNA-based etc.). Complex molecules as such tend to present unique process development challenges that requires additional and unique process and analytical characterization and optimization efforts. You are crucial to advising and leading development of successful drug product processes for non-traditional modalities and ensure optimal product quality during manufacture. A Day As a Staff Scientist May Look Like Will lead and advise on capability, technology development & knowledge build with regards to process development and optimization within FDG for gene therapy modalities (AAV, RNA-based etc.). Be able to align process development capability for gene therapy programs with collaborators, including R&pD teams, Viral Production Core and Manufacturing team. Responsible for leading process development activities across programs, different stages of development, independently implementing and advising on at-scale and small-scale unit operations. Lead process characterization, optimization, scale-up and tech transfer, author development reports, support preclinical, clinical & PPQ phase related campaigns, facilitate risk assessments and technology transfers as well as review regulatory submissions. Will be accountable for development of scalable and robust processes (using engineering principles and methodologies) for vials and syringes( ex. drug substance freezing/thawing, compounding, mixing, filtration, filling, and lyophilization) Ensure strong strategic partnerships & communication with colleagues from Research groups, pre-clinical toxicology, Drug Product & Drug Substance Manufacturing (internal and external partners, CMOs), Project Management, Regulatory Sciences, and Quality Lead, review and complete project plans supported by strong scientific rationales and technical approaches & will be an effective communicator. Will be cognizant of project priorities (e.g., memos, reports) and timelines. Will participate in scientific conferences and forums to seek out, recognize and assesses new technologies to facilitate efficient and robust process development within FDG. This Role May Be For You If Strong project leadership & strong industry knowledge and experience in gene therapy drug product development & delivery technologies is required. Strong scientific leadership and management experience is required. Experience in general biologics product development including understanding of formulation, process and characterization fundamentals across various relevant modalities (e.g. mAbs, fusion proteins) and delivery forms is desired. Experience in developing relationships with external vendors, CROs, academic institutions and scientific leaders. Interpersonal and leadership skills and ability to influence others to achieve results. Experience mentoring junior scientists To be considered you must have a PhD in Pharmaceutics, Biotechnology, Biomedical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Biology or related field with a strong background in gene therapy-based drug product development and 3+ years industry experience. Experience in AAVs, RNA therapeutics is desired. Does this sound like you? Apply now to take your first steps toward living the Regeneron Way! jobTitle: Staff Scientist, Formulation Development (AAV, Gene Therapy)
jobDescription: Regeneron is seeking a highly motivated PhD Staff Scientist within the Formulation Development Group (FDG). We lead all formulation and drug product development for Regeneron’s Genetic Medicine programs, in particular Adeno-Associated Virus (AAV) programs, to move the genetic medicine drug assets from research to preclinical development, clinical development and all the way to commercialization. You will also carry out research on new formulation development and characterization of novel AAV vectors. A Typical Day May Look Like Lead FDG activities for gene therapy programs, e.g. AAV, in collaboration with analytical and drug product process development and other cross-functional teams Serve as a program lead and subject matter expert at the cross-functional research, CMC and program teams Design and implement biochemical and biophysical characterization and pre-formulation studies to support evaluation of preclinical drug candidates and developing preclinical and first-in-human (FIH) formulations Independently design, complete and document stability studies and other experiments for FDG Seek out, recognize and assess new technologies to improve formulation development and analytical characterization Lead research activities toward developing new formulations and characterizing critical quality attributes and stabilities for novel AAV vectors Author and review formulation development sections of regulatory and technical documents, study reports and technology transfer documents This Role May Be For You If You have prior experience and strong technical knowledge working with viral vectors such as AAV, Lentivirus or other retrovirus vectors for gene and cell therapy products. You have hands-on experience and trouble-shooting proficiency with analytical and characterization techniques for biomolecules, such as column chromatography (HPLC/UPLC), capillary electrophoresis and/or biophysical techniques You have a passion for science with a motivation for making contributions and thrive in fast-paced team environment. You are capable of multi-tasking, working both independently and within a team environment. To be considered for this role, you must have a PhD in Chemistry, Biochemistry, Biophysics, Pharmaceutical Sciences, or a related field with 3+ years of industry experience. Must have experience in AAV or Gene Therapy. #REGNGeneTherapyAD Does this sound like you? Apply now to take your first steps toward living the Regeneron Way! The Viral Delivery Technologies group is seeking an independent and highly motivated Staff Scientist to aid in developing novel viral vectors. This role involves leading a small team of researchers to design, characterize, and validate novel Adeno-associated virus (AAV) vectors in vitro and in vivo. You will work directly with therapeutic groups to expand upon our antibody-retargeted viral vector platform for gene therapy applications by developing the efficacy and tissue specificity of vectors. As a staff scientist within the Viral Delivery Technologies group, a typical day might include: Designing, executing, analyzing, and troubleshooting in vitro experiments to characterize and validate new antibody target receptors and viral vector designs. Performing basic molecular biology techniques (Cloning, Western blotting, DNA/RNA extractions, PCR, RT-PCR, quantitative PCR, etc.) Work closely with therapeutic groups to identify targets, design in vivo experiments, evaluate vector biodistribution, and develop therapeutic applications of retargeted viral vectors. Evaluating candidate antibodies to target tissues of cell types of interest for viral gene delivery. Balance working in the lab directly and effectively delegating tasks to a small team of reports. Coordinating with CROs to evaluate candidate viral vectors in non-human primate models. Working collaboratively with other department team members and with collaborators in various therapeutic focus areas across research and discovery. Participation in team meetings and preparation of regular presentations for departmental meetings. This Role May Be For You If You Enjoy working in an innovation driven, highly collaborative and fast paced environment Have an affinity for bioengineering and technology development focused projects Are able to effectively balance multiple projects independently across multiple subjects Have excellent presentation and communication skills Have keen attention to detail To be considered for this position you must have a PhD and 7 years of expertise in cell biology, molecular biology, protein purification, and antibodies. Specific experience required includes mammalian cell culture, manipulation and purification of viruses or proteins, plasmid cloning, and use of antibodies for various applications. Familiarity with key antibody properties, gene expression, viral vectors, and assessing biodistribution and immunohistochemistry data is desired. Does this sound like you? The Statistical Programmer Provides support to the lead programmer and the study team on all programming activities according to the study requirements and the timelines. This role assists on studies in various therapeutical areas and all clinical trial phases. You will implement and completes the programming and project standard under general supervision of the management to support ongoing clinical studies and requests for study report, regulatory submission, and ad hoc/post hoc analysis. Maintains programming documentations such as study tracker, code, logs, and analysis outputs in a regulated environment. You may participate in and support department goals and SME topics. In this role, a typical day might include the following: Provide programming support within multiple studies/projects in various study activities with timely and high-quality programming results as assigned tasks and projects Work with your manager in cross-functional collaborations to support the study conduct and reporting activities. Maintain all documentation in accordance with SOPs/Guidance/WI/process to ensure traceability and regulatory compliance Participate and contribute towards department goals and SME topics This Role May Be For You If Follow Regeneron processes and policies around retention of data, records, and information for clinical trials. Show dedication to and perform consistently to ensure high quality results. You have had exposure to relational database structure. You have understanding of reporting systems and experience with implementing standardization methodology To be considered you'll need a Bachelor's Degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Life Science or related field with 1 to 3 years of programming experience, preferably in processing clinical trial data in the biotechnology, pharmaceutical or health related industry. An advanced degree is preferred. SAS Certification a plus. Experience in SAS programming, preferably in a clinical data environment. Does this sound like you? We are currently looking to fill a Statistician position to support our growth. Regeneron successfully manufactures a range of biopharmaceuticals for patients worldwide, including our approved therapeutic proteins and those involved in clinical studies. The Statistician will support the production of life-saving medications by applying their knowledge of statistical process control to support the validation and trending of manufacturing and testing processes. As a Statistician, a typical day might include the following: Performing reviews of standard protocol and report review for statistical accuracy thoroughly and on time Applying fundamental statistical knowledge to fulfill ad-hoc statistical analysis requests from teams throughout the business Utilizing statistical thinking to generate appropriate designed experiments to achieve targeted goals Generating technical reports and memos with support from your team Participating in activities associated with the Statistics Training Series, including mentoring employees enrolled in the final research project This Role Might Be For You If You Thrive in a team environment where you work and learn alongside subject matter experts to keep projects advancing to completion Are skilled in the areas of written and verbal communication across different levels Have a working knowledge of statistical software packages (JMP, Minitab, R or SAS) Are familiar with common statistical methods such as multivariate regression, difference and equivalency testing, design of experiments, and control charts Are open and receptive to change, while looking for opportunities to continuously improve process performance Enjoy working within a team environment and contributing towards shared strategic goals To be considered for the Statistician position, applicants must have a Master’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field, and 2+ years' experience. Level will be determined based on qualifications relevant to the role. Associate Statistician - Requires MS and 0-2 years' experience Does this sound like you? jobTitle: Summer 2023 Intern –Masters in Training Development, Corporate Training, Instructional Design, or Related Majors (Tarrytown, NY Region)
jobDescription: If you’re a student pursuing a Masters in Education in Training Development, Corporate Training, Instructional Design, Learning Technology, Organizational Development or related, you may be a fit for an internship in our Commercial Training department. Tarrytown, NY is where medicines are discovered. Our robust research and development engine allows us to discover therapies that could have a profound impact on patient health and scientific outcomes. We generate ideas, explore them and challenge them on their way to becoming life-changing medicines. Our unique ability to repeatedly and consistently translate science into medicine has led to a robust pipeline of clinical-stage medicines, all of which were discovered in our laboratories. Our investigational treatments target allergic and inflammatory diseases, cancer, cardiovascular and metabolic diseases, neuromuscular diseases, infectious diseases and rare diseases. It’s a collegial place where science leads, and you’ll be supplied with what you need to do great work. We’re creative thinkers and rigorous workers. We never lose sight of the fact that the work we do here can change the world. Project Description The Commercial Training and Development Department is looking for two summer interns, who will work remotely, that will gain hands-on experience in an exciting, fast-paced environment. You will gain an understanding of multiple roles and functions in the Commercial Training and Development. You will be directly involved with assisting training managers with Curriculum Development. This may include designing, developing, and recommending training curricula and workshops based on adult learning principles for our commercial field teams. It can also include interviews, needs assessments and instructional design. There is also an emphasis on new micro learning content and application for this position. You will also learn the importance of collaboration across internal/external stakeholders. In this role, a typical summer might include the following: Achieving a general understanding of what happens in our global organization Completing hands-on project work that has an impact on the business Engaging with Regeneron leadership Collaborating with other interns Establishing connections with Regeneron’s diverse employee resource groups Participating in professional development sessions while enjoying lots of free food and swag Showcasing the knowledge you gained through end of program presentation sessions Getting paid for your hard work! This Role Might Be For You If You want to make a difference You advocate for your ideas – and what they can do in the world You’re excited to think, challenge, listen, re-think and solve You continuously look for ways to improve You are science-minded, ask questions and challenge conventional wisdom You work with precision, passion, intellect and integrity You’re ready to work with the team that can bring a great idea to life You know this is no ordinary job Please submit a resume and cover letter in your application. Simply add a cover letter as an additional document in your application. To be considered for this opportunity, you must be enrolled in an academic program pursuing a Masters in Training and Development, Curriculum and Instruction, Corporate Training, Instructional Design or related degree. Skilled in MS Office Suite. A passion for education and interest in science is desired. A cumulative GPA of 3.0 is preferred. We want someone who is able to commit to 40 hours per week for a minimum of 10 weeks from the end of May/ early June through August. Demonstrated leadership in areas such as campus activities, clubs, sports, current or previous work, or within the community is also preferred. Please See Hourly Rate Ranges Below Please note that our intern and co-op pay ranges are determined by level of education (year in school) and degree program. jobTitle: Summer 2023 Law Intern – Data Privacy Law (Tarrytown, NY Region)
jobDescription: If you are a student pursuing a Law degree, you may be a fit for an internship in our Data Privacy Department. Tarrytown, NY is where medicines are discovered. Our robust research and development engine allows us to discover therapies that could have a profound impact on patient health and scientific outcomes. Our unique ability to repeatedly and consistently translate science into medicine has led to a robust pipeline of clinical-stage medicines, all of which were discovered in our laboratories. It’s a collegial place where science leads, and you’ll be supplied with what you need to do great work. We’re creative thinkers and rigorous workers. Project Description Regeneron’s Data Privacy Office seeks a law student who is passionate about privacy and biotechnology for a ten-week summer 2022 position in Tarrytown, NY. You should have some background knowledge in data protection and privacy law and experience working in a medium-to-large organization, preferably life sciences and/or healthcare law. Our office offers an opportunity for you to leverage your law background and applied work experience to broaden your legal, business, and project management skills in a rewarding and challenging environment. You will work on projects across our global enterprise, including the implementation of Privacy-by-Design measures, research of legal issues, development of privacy notices, and support the operationalization of our privacy program. Issues may include privacy concerns such as, but not limited to, Big Data and wearable technologies, patient or employee data, deidentification standards, biometrics and AI. jobDescription: If you are a student pursuing a Law Degree you may be a fit for an internship in our Intellectual Property department. Tarrytown, NY is where medicines are discovered. Position 2: This position is within the Therapeutics IP group of the Intellectual Property department, based in Tarrytown, NY. This student will research and analyze clinical trial-based US patent filing trends in the biopharma industry and report their findings to the Intellectual Property department. We are currently looking to fill a Quality Control (QC) Supervisor on our Cell and Reagent Core team with a Mon – Fri, 8 AM – 4:30pm schedule. Regeneron successfully manufactures and tests products for patient safety. The QC Supervisor will oversee a variety of mammalian cell handling functions. This role will also have direct reports to manage and coordinate the cell core function. As a QC Supervisor, a typical day might include the following: Supervises staff, distributes workload, and monitors progress. Writes and/or Reviews study protocols and reports. Attends cross-functional meetings as a representative of QC and to remain informed of business needs Ensures compliance with applicable cGMP regulations and SOPs. Performs personnel management functions including time sheet submissions, scheduling of vacations, personnel development, and performance evaluations. Oversees daily operation of activities in area. Supports internal and regulatory audits. Ensures personnel receive proper and prompt training. Ensures that safety standards are maintained. Coordinate cell culture tasks, and identify cell banking needs Support laboratory investigations and assay troubleshooting as needed Ensure that safety and current Good Manufacturing Practice standards are maintained Communicate effectively with management on complex matters Drive and manage projects within the group This Role Might Be For You If Ability to maintain integrity and honesty at all times. Ability to work independently or as part of a team. Ability to communicate with transparency. Continuously drive to improve processes for improved performance. Demonstrate respectful behavior at all times. Basic working knowledge of Microsoft Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint). Effective time management skills. Ability to follow verbal and written instructions. Strong interpersonal skills. Communicate effectively with peers and demonstrate teamwork Follow directions well and demonstrate flexibility; work cooperatively as a team leader, an individual contributor, and as a team member Coach team members in troubleshooting cell issues, morphology changes, and preventing contaminations Ability to work under limited supervision. Accept responsibility for deadlines To be considered for the QC Supervisor, Cell and Reagent Core as part of our Bioassay team you must be willing and able to work Mon - Fri, 8 AM – 4:30 PM. You must have the following; BS/BA in Life Sciences or related field; will substitute relevant experience for education and at least 1 year of leadership experience. Experience with mammalian cell culture practices, bioassay techniques, and GMP/GLP experience preferred. Level is determined based on qualifications relevant to the role. Regeneron is looking for a Quality Control Supervisor focused in Microbiology with Bulk/DS manufacturing experience. The position will have a 1st shift, Tuesday-Saturday, 6am-2:30pm schedule. Regeneron successfully manufactures a range of biopharmaceuticals for patients worldwide, including our approved therapeutic proteins as well as those involved in clinical studies. Our Quality Control Microbiology Department is responsible for activities related to pharmaceutical microbiology including environmental, personnel and utility monitoring, raw material, in-process, and product release testing. This position will be responsible for ensuring daily operations are completed accurately, timely, and reliably to ensure our medicines are safe and effective before reaching patients around the world. As a QC Microbiology Supervisor, a typical day might include the following: Coordinate testing and monitoring activities within the QC lab and manufacturing facility Review test results, procedures, protocols, and quality system records Attend cross-functional meetings as a representative of QC and to remain informed of business needs Organize and support laboratory investigations and assay troubleshooting as needed Support internal and regulatory audits Ensure that safety and current Good Manufacturing Practice standards are maintained Execute personnel management functions including performance evaluations, personnel development, and scheduling time off Communicate effectively with management on complex matters; support laboratory management in mid to long range team goals Drive and manage projects within the group This Role Might Be For You If You Communicate effectively with peers and demonstrate teamwork Perform work with honesty, integrity, and respect Follow directions well and demonstrate flexibility; work cooperatively as a team leader, an individual contributor, and as a team member Coach team members in troubleshooting microbiology methods, EM/aseptic techniques and equipment Ability to work under limited supervision. Accept responsibility for deadlines To be considered for the QC Microbiology Supervisor position, you must be willing and able to work 1st shift, Tuesday-Saturday, 6am-2:30pm. Regeneron's VelociGene is looking for a highly driven Supervisor to lead a team of Animal Research Associates to carry out the daily operations within the transgenic colony. Coordinate with managers and other supervisors to fulfill cohort requirements. Ensure data is entered accurately and timely in the database. A Typical Day In This Role Looks Like Performs and leads a team for all basic tasks necessary for the processing of genetically altered mice, such as animal identification by marking, breeding, weaning, and collection of tissue samples for DNA or RNA analysis. Observes mice for obvious phenotype and performs a natural history analysis when requested. Records and mines essential data in the VelociGene Data Management System(VGDMS). Masters the utilization and navigation of the VGDMS and ensures accurate data entry of supervisors. Possesses sound colony management skills, while responsible for some colony management and cohort production. Coordinate with peers, within group and external groups, to carry out the process of cohort generation and delivery. Responsible for leading a small team with daily responsibilities and data entry. Performs additional responsibilities related to the packing and shipping of mice, as well as some basic vivarium tasks such as ordering supplies, and general maintenance when needed. This Role May Be For You If You have previous work with the handling of laboratory rodents and specifically mice is preferred. The execution of above tasks will be guided by the Velocigene Data Management System and by instruction from the Colony Manager. Experience and competency with Microsoft Office. Good communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to work within a team and to lead a small group of individuals. To be considered for this role, you must have a minimum of an AA degree with some biology course work. A minimum of 3 years experience with genetically modified mice and/or a minimum of five years with other laboratory animals. Does this sound like you? jobTitle: Supply Planning & Reporting Analyst for Commercial Programs
jobDescription: The Supply Chain department is hiring! The Supply Planning & Reporting Analyst provides leadership for the Integrated Planning & Capacities, Product Demand, Product Data, and Product Supply teams. This position establishes standards and practices for a model supply chain, including developing policies, procedures and techniques that are consistent with the strategic IOPS direction and sound principles of supply chain management. As a Supply Planning & Reporting Analyst, a typical day might include the following: May manage the Process, Demand Planning Process, Supply Planning Process and Continuous Improvement Initiatives. Understands and raises supply risks and constraints across end to end program networks. Guides alignment with internal and external manufacturing team members to develop production plans, including partners and collaborators. May be responsible for managing forecasting and demand intake activities associated with clinical, commercial and independent demand. Works with cross-functional teams to ensure effective and principled planning of materials to meet requirements as defined by program development (commercial, clinical and independent) by consistently achieving customer orders. Actively seeks creative supply solutions to optimize Supply Chain Planning. Supports compliance activities for Supply Chain. Drives continuous improvements initiatives and improve Supply Chain Planning process development by presenting performance standards, developing joint improvement initiatives and actively soliciting formal feedback. Builds and publishes metrics to evaluate overall plan/process efficiency that drive positive results, get to root cause and support annual IOPS objectives. Maintains awareness of current industry standards, trends and practices. Approach business challenges from a macro perspective, resolves strategic issues effectively and supports the Supply Chain leadership team by providing timely analysis of tactical operations and long-term strategic needs. Assists with regular operational meetings, goal setting and mid-year/year-end reporting. Represents as needed or performs other activities as required by the business. Embraces and promotes the Regeneron Way. This Role May Be For You If Previous experience in planning, drug development, performance metrics and project management. Ability to manage multiple, sophisticated projects and changing priorities, work extended hours when required, make sound decisions under pressure and work effectively in a team environment. Proficiency in MS Office, Excel, Oracle and Access Database. Excellent time management, interpersonal skills and written and verbal communication skills. Strong analytical skills and ability to communicate details clearly and effectively. Attention to detail, fact-based, self-motivated and ability to work under pressure. Strong working knowledge of supply chain management at both the development stage for clinical supplies as well as at the commercial stage preferred. Agile/Lean/Six Sigma/Continuous Improvement knowledge a plus. To be considered for this role you must hold a bachelor’s degree in Business, Supply Chain Management or Science background and Associate Analyst: 0-2 years experience Analyst: 2+ years experience Senior Analyst: 5+ years experience Equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered; leveling is decided on during an interview process Pharmaceutical or biotechnology experience a plus. Master’s degree a plus. Does this sound like you? Apply now to take your first steps toward living the Regeneron Way! The Talent Sourcer will work collaboratively with the recruiting teams and business leaders to identify and build talent pools enabling the proactive hiring of world-class talent across Regeneron. The ideal candidate will have notable experience in developing and implementing sourcing strategies. This individual will also demonstrate a high level of proficiency with relevant technology platforms. We know this is an exciting opportunity to help transform Regeneron’s approach to talent acquisition as an initial member of the talent sourcing and pipelining team. This role is a contract assignment. As a Talent Sourcer, a typical day might include the following: Development of sourcing and research plans and experimenting with creative talent research and pipelining techniques Partnering with recruiters and the business to understand and shape technical and functional requirements, key competencies, and cultural fit Establishing talent pipelines through referral generation, using external professional networks and alternative search techniques to target, attract, and develop talent prospects Performing structured interviews and assessments to accurately assess skills, competencies and fit within the Regeneron culture, and promote the opportunity Building talent communities and outreach campaigns to actively engage talent over time Reporting out on progress and established metrics and recommending changes in approach supported by the data This Role Might Be For You If You are passionate about the “hunt” for top talent and always find yourself gravitating toward the research and sourcing aspects of talent acquisition You no longer want to be bound by requisitions but instead wish to focus on building critical talent pools to address the ongoing and critical needs of the organization You can operate effectively in a “start-up” model, as this is a completely new team and focus for the organization You are at ease with an abundance of detail and complexity and can align your efforts within the framework of the broader talent acquisition strategy You have the dedication to handle multiple projects and initiatives, prioritize them and implement them independently, while keeping all parties informed and engaged To be considered for this opportunity, we prefer individuals with a Bachelor’s degree and proven Talent Pipelining/Talent Sourcing/Talent Research/Talent Acquisition experience. We are willing to consider exceptional talent with the commensurate experience who have not completed a four-year degree. We prefer eight or more years of relevant sourcing and recruiting background. Previous experience within the biotech or pharmaceutical industries is also strongly preferred. You must be adept at using a variety of recruiting technologies (ATS, CRM, LinkedIn, etc.) to both source and organize talent pools. Previous talent identification and/or research experience within a recruitment agency and/or executive search firm is strongly preferred. We are open to fully remote / work from home arrangements. The Temporary Statistical Programmer Provides support to the lead programmer and the study team on all programming activities according to the study requirements and the timelines. This role assists on studies in various therapeutical areas and all clinical trial phases. You will implement and completes the programming and project standard under general supervision of the management to support ongoing clinical studies and requests for study report, regulatory submission, and ad hoc/post hoc analysis. Maintains programming documentations such as study tracker, code, logs, and analysis outputs in a regulated environment. You may participate in and support department goals and SME topics. In this role, a typical day might include the following: Provide programming support within multiple studies/projects in various study activities with timely and high-quality programming results as assigned tasks and projects Work with your manager in cross-functional collaborations to support the study conduct and reporting activities. Maintain all documentation in accordance with SOPs/Guidance/WI/process to ensure traceability and regulatory compliance Participate and contribute towards department goals and SME topics This Role May Be For You If Follow Regeneron processes and policies around retention of data, records, and information for clinical trials. Show dedication to and perform consistently to ensure high quality results. You have had exposure to relational database structure. You have understanding of reporting systems and experience with implementing standardization methodology To be considered you'll need a Bachelor's Degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Life Science or related field with 1 to 3 years of programming experience, preferably in processing clinical trial data in the biotechnology, pharmaceutical or health related industry. An advanced degree is preferred. SAS Certification a plus. Experience in SAS programming, preferably in a clinical data environment. Does this sound like you? A statistical programmer contractor provides timely support to the study team on all programming matters according to the project strategies. Requirements will be identified according to a Statistical Analysis Plan and programming specifications using internal standards and guidelines. The incumbent implements and completes the programming and project standards. Works independently in the design and testing of program logic, coding programs, program documentation and preparation of programs. Supports ongoing clinical studies requests for statistical and non-statistical analyses. Meets statistical ad hoc requests of senior management. Provides documentation and consistent maintenance of code, logs, and output in a regulated environment. In this role, a typical day might include the following: Support programmer within a study team involved in the creation and QC of analysis datasets TFL's or standard tools following Regeneron standard data models or user requirements. Apply standard tools developed for the study or project. Participate in development of new standards and tools. Follow all company SOP and guidelines in the creation of the programming results. Adheres to procedures surrounding retention of data, records, and information for clinical studies. This Role May Be For You If You have experience in SAS programming, preferably in a clinical data environment. Along with exposure of relational database structure. We need you to have full understanding of reporting systems. We expect you to have experience with implementing standardization methodology. Demonstrated collaboration and interpersonal skills, strong verbal and written communication skills in a global environment are required. Your ability to support study requirements with challenging timelines under direct supervision by the programming lead is essential. To be Considered you must have SAS, (Base, Stat, Macro, graph). MS. (BS) in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Life Science or related field with 5 -7 years of programming experience preferably in processing clinical trial data in the biotechnology, pharmaceutical or health related industry. SAS Certification a plus. This is an opportunity to join our select team that is already leading the way in the Pharmaceutical/Biotech industry. #GDRAJobs Does this sound like you? Regeneron Pharmaceuticals’ Department of Drug Safety and Pharmacometrics is offering a 2-week externship in toxicologic pathology. This externship will take place at Regeneron's corporate site which is focused on all phases of drug development and is staffed with 7 board-certified Anatomic Pathologists with innovative microscopic imaging and analysis facilities. In This Role a Typical Day Might Include Microscopic pathology experience with a variety of strains of rodents (mouse and rats) Experience with digital pathology and image analysis in the context of discovery and preclinical safety assessment A preview of the activities of a toxicologic pathologist in a pharmaceutical company Access to transgenic rodents which provides a strong background in animal species that are not traditionally assessed in an academia residency training Externship may provide time and opportunity for small pathology projects and will also include observation of various phases of a toxicology study, conversations with senior scientists working in allied disciplines such as toxicology, safety pharmacology, Quality Assurance and participation in relevant departmental meetings This Role Might Be For You If You are currently a resident in an anatomic pathology training program or are a Veterinary Pathology fellow (who has previously completed a pathology residency) You wish to further your training in and exposure to toxicologic and rodent pathology You are a highly motivated fourth year veterinary students with experience in pathology and a demonstrable interest in toxicologic pathology. You are highly self-motivated and have a clear and demonstrable interest and ongoing experience in anatomic pathology, particularly histopathology. Applicants should be currently enrolled in a veterinary anatomic pathology residency with at least 1 year of experience evaluating diagnostic case material or be employed in a fellowship. Veterinary student candidates should be enrolled in an AVMA-accredited veterinary college, be in their 4th year. This is a paid externship (housing is not provided). Applications should include a CV, contact information for 3 references, and a letter of interest, describing professional background, interests and goals, and pathology experience and preparation. We are looking for a Veeva CRM/Salesforce Technical Architect within the Commercial IT Global Sales Technology team. The role will provide technical design, configuration and execution support for global sales technology, manage technical specifications, design throughout the lifecycle of technology, including primarily Veeva, associated modules and platforms. The role will provide technical design, configuration and execution support for global sales technology, manage technical specifications, design throughout the lifecycle of technology, including primarily Veeva, associated modules and platforms. Lead and identify areas of advancements and support by creating technical proof of concepts and solution conceptualization for commercial partners. Drive projects by ensuring that standards and processes are followed to deliver a well governed and controlled implementation approach. Bring pharmaceuticals experience to enable the delivery of new CRM capabilities that are required to drive key strategic goals. As a Veeva CRM/Salesforce Technical Architect , a typical day might include the following: Define a product vision that is differentiated and delivers unique value to the Commercial field force Leverage people, process, and technology to help senior leadership with the establishment of CRM strategy that aligns to the business strategy, engaging partners, and supporting a World Class and robust CRM system Manage transition and knowledge transfer to post-production support; provide leadership and support to the service provider, where necessary to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues Participate in requirement gathering efforts to provide feedback on technical feasibility and viability in addition to standard methodologies for Veeva. Collaborate with cross functional teams (Data Management, AMS, Field Sales, Field Reimbursement, Commercial Operations etc.) to set CRM release roadmap. Ensure the quality and on time delivery of technical implementation projects/programs with supporting deliverables and artifacts. Continue to monitor industry trends for new technology capabilities being raised by peer pharmaceutical and healthcare organizations. Contribute to the development of repeatable solution frameworks, thought leadership, and client offerings through personal experience and perspective This Job Might Be For You If You have provided technical leadership over client integration efforts and managed a team of contractors delivering client integrations including data feed integrations, Veeva (CRM) integrations, and API client integrations. You have an eye for detail and pride yourself on the quality of your work. Operational excellence matters more than just finishing the tasks. With your sleeves rolled up, you work on current problems while thinking of future solutions. You have a collaborative agile approach to drive creative and efficient use of technology and thrive in a team environment. You can create roadmap, business case and other supporting artefacts to define scope, assess complexity and develop solution approach for multi-phase implementation program. You are a highly skilled technologist who can strategize the full lifecycle of product production — from conception through to release. You have strong communication skills and able to translate technical concepts to non-technical terms and partners. To be considered for this opportunity, you must have a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science as well as 8+ years of experience delivering IT technology platforms. Veeva and/or Salesforce system administration certification (preferred). Deep technical expertise on Veeva and Salesforce, understanding of the real-world use of CRM capabilities by the sales organization in life sciences industry. Hands-on configuration and admin experience with Veeva Commercial suite (CRM & Vault PromoMats) and Salesforce.com. Understanding of integration capabilities across the products in the suite and base salesforce.com functionality. Experience with data collection, designing workflows, and audit requirements to determine suitability of the CRM software. Experience with Field Deployment Activities, such as realignments, and Veeva Align tool. Proven track record building technology with Veeva (CRM, Align, CLM, Events Management, Suggestions) and Salesforce.com applications. Experience partnering and collaborating with Pharmaceutical Field Sales and Commercial Operations functions. Experience working with global sales team with history of successful sampling and product launches. Experience in integration architecture and patterns including integration via APIs and services is required. Expertise translating and presenting technical concepts into practical business terms for leaders in both small and large group settings. Experience managing all elements of the product development lifecycle. Knowledge and understanding of Pharmaceutical commercial reporting and data integration capabilities using modern technologies (e.g. Tableau/Qlik, Dell Boomi, API Gateway, AWS S3/RedShift), ServiceNow, JIRA and Master Data Management. Regeneron is seeking a highly motivated Vet Tech to assist our Veterinarians and Vivarium Management in administering a program of health and welfare to the rodent barrier and conventional colonies. A typical day as a Vet Tech Might look like: Provides clinical support for rodent health care including but not limited to sick checks, anesthesia, analgesia, euthanasia and surgery Coordinates/assists with transfers of rodent within and between facilities Performs Health Surveillance Sampling Conducts Post Approval Monitoring of housing/procedure rooms Assists with training program for animal husbandry staff and research staff utilizing animals Pursues continuing education in lab animal medicine and managerial/leadership courses on Talent Hub Prepares a presentation and presents at one monthly Veterinary Service Seminar per year This May Be The Role For You If You enjoy working within a team and can collaborate with colleagues. We would also prefer a candidate with knowledge of applicable regulations regarding the accurate standards of animal care and use in a research environment is desired. Does this sound like you? We are currently looking to fill a Visual Inspection Specialist with a 1st shift, Monday-Friday, from 8:00 a.m.-5:00 p.m. schedule. Regeneron optimally manufactures a range of biopharmaceuticals for patients worldwide, including our approved therapeutic proteins and those involved in clinical studies. Our Visual Inspection Specialist will serve as a guide for vision inspection (manual, semi-automated) directly supporting the operations team. They will support equipment selection and design as well as, process development activities. The Visual Inspection (VI) Specialist will be key in establishing and supervising the visual inspection program as well as, the development of product specific recipes for the range of equipment and processes. What To Look Forward To Competitive Compensation - Regeneron offers highly competitive base pay and employees working premium shifts receive incentive pay, such as shift differential and/or weekend pay. All employees receive equity awards and are eligible for annual performance bonuses. We offer comprehensive health coverage, tuition reimbursement, and qualified employees may receive assistance paying down student loans. Relocation assistance is also available for eligible new hires. Work Life Balance - We provide an onsite gym and rock-climbing wall, daycare, physical wellbeing programs, tuition reimbursement, generous paid time off, and holidays. Emotional Wellbeing Support - Regeneron prides itself in supporting employees. We provide onsite behavioral health counselors, emotional wellbeing webinars, and Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) to all employees. Employees enrolled in any of our health plans are eligible for additional mental health support. Regeneron Culture - We pride ourselves on our outstanding culture! Regeneron has best-in-class onsite and offsite events throughout the year, onsite cafeterias, company affiliated sports teams and clubs, and a culture centered on diversity and inclusion. They will be responsible for supporting the development of test / KNAPP sets and building technical content in support of the training and qualification program. As a Visual Inspection Specialist, a typical day might include the following: Responsible for building and maintaining test sets and KNAPP samples Partners cross functionally to establish a philosophy for visual inspection and visual inspection qualification for the operators Responsible for building the technical content for training / qualification curriculum for operators Support the development of programs for classification and storage of rejects, in conjunction with operations and quality assurance Supports implementation / qualification of inspection processes Responsible for recipe development and life cycle management of semi-automated and fully automated processes Reviews, edits, completes, and revises completed batch records, logbooks, and SOPs in accordance with cGMP standards and compliant with written procedure Completes training and maintains required qualifications for visual inspection Ensures all tasks are performed in a manner consistent with cGMP SOP’s and safety standards Participates in equipment start-up, commissioning, and validation activities Gathers, trends, and analyzes process generated data Support investigations associated with internal inspection activities Documents all training Assists with training of new employees as advised Travel (domestic and international) may be required to support new equipment purchases and / or training Assists/chips in all areas of visual inspection as needed Must be able to lift/push/pull at least 40lbs This Role Might Be For You If You have knowledge of cGMP manufacturing environment and familiarity with visual inspection of liquid and lyophilized products You have experience using and / or developing test sets and KNAPP samples You have proven strong interpersonal, cross- cultural, communication, negotiation and problem-solving skills You can exhibit confidence, have a high emotional IQ, and proven ingenuity, creativity and resourcefulness You have gained an understanding from provided instructions and worked towards established goals individually or as part of a team as the need arises You are able to understand and listen to team members and collaborators’ needs while supporting a positive team environment To be considered for the Visual Inspection Specialist position you must be willing and able to work 1st shift, Monday-Friday, from 8:00 a.m.-5:00 p.m. You must have the following; Assoc Specialist: Requires a BS equivalent combination of education and experience. Specialist: Requires a BS with 2+ years industry experience or equivalent combination of education and experience. Job Description We are looking for a Warehouse Associate to be responsible for receiving, recording, tracking, documenting, and delivering all incoming and outgoing material & mail. Ensures that all deliverable material is distributed to end-users in a timely manner, documents receipt, and uses computerized tools to record and update transactions. Works with end-users on all inventory needs and assists with all material being returned for repair or credit to vendors. Provides general assistance and support services as needed. Assists with discrepancy reconciliation. May be asked to work overtime. A Typical Day Might Include Delivering packages to end-users Operation/Driving company vehicles Loads and unloads company delivery trucks Replenish stockroom with incoming material Responsible for picking and delivering inventory orders Notifies EHS department of all incoming radioactive material Responsible for scanning invoices, packing slips, etc Responsible for incoming/outgoing U.S. Mail Responsible for inter-office and priority overnight correspondence Responsible for kitchen and office/printer supplies Provide general Facilities support as needed, including moves & relocations Enters inventory orders and matches arrivals into Oracle database Records all items received daily into department logbook. Responsible for picking up and shipping out of all returns from end-users. This Role Might Be For You If You have 3-6 months of related experience in a warehouse and/or training. Power Jack and Forklift experience is required, certification is preferred. Qualifications High school diploma minimum Ability to lift up to 45 lbs Valid driver’s license recognized by New York State with a clear driving record Must have excellent written and oral communication skills. Computer proficiency a must, knowledge of UPS and Federal Express systems a plus. Does this sound like you? Apply now to take your first steps toward living the Regeneron Way! The following specifications provide the job requirements for Wearable Data Scientist for the Digital Health Technology group within Biostatistics and Data Management Department (BDM). As a Wearable Data Scientist a typical day might include: Responsible for supporting the Digital Health Technology group to perform hands-on statistical analyses of clinical data collected by a wide range of Digital Health Technologies including wearable devices. Works under supervision and guidance of experience statisticians and device engineers, including the support of digital biomarkers development and exploratory data science. This Role Might Be For You If You Can Performs analyses of clinical and digital biomarker data and prepares tables/figures to show and explain the results. Prepares statistical analysis plans in both slide and text form. Prepares summaries of exploratory analyses, in both slide and text form, and presents results to both statisticians and non-statistician collaborators. Performs quality control and pre-processing of data collected with digital health technologies. Creates and optimizes statistical computing scripts (R and/or Python). Aids development and improvement of novel and existing digital biomarkers. Working with data managers and programmers, ensures flow of data coming from wearable devices into appropriate regulated data systems. Supports design, execution and reporting of clinical trials. To be considered for this opportunity, you must have the following: PhD graduate or MSc with at least four years of experience in Data Science, Biomedical Engineering, Computer Science, Biostatistics or related fields. Proficient in R and Python programming. Able to work in a dynamic environment, with attention to detail. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Experience/skills performing exploratory data analysis, machine learning, statistical analysis, handling and manipulating large datasets, and producing high-quality and informative graphics. Matlab programming is a plus. Knowledge of biosensors technology is a plus #GDBDMJobs Does this sound like you? Apply now to take your first steps toward living the Regeneron Way! This HRIS role, Manager, HR Technology will be responsible for supporting the organization’s Workday recruiting module and partnering with Talent Acquisition stakeholders to drive continuous improvement. The ideal candidate will ensure fit for purpose business processes by recognizing the needs of business customers, evaluating options, identifying gaps and potential fits, participating in release planning, managing solution delivery, change management and communication with stakeholders. As a Manager, HR Technology a typical day may include Serve as a system administrator for Workday Recruiting module and the go-to subject matter expert Provide support to functional owners and end users by diagnosing, troubleshooting, and resolving complex system issues. Researches and minimizes reported problems or pain points within HR platforms, drives resolution of issues, analyzes security issues and recommends corrective and proactive action. Partner with internal team members to develop long-term scalable solutions that help improve HR processes and streamline user experience. Build consensus around business processes, business rules, workflows and design. Translate business objectives and user needs into clearly written requirements. Partner with vendors on their software and cloud roadmaps, upgrades, restoration of service or resolution of problems. Create and maintain documentation on Business Processes, configuration, and other materials. Implement testing to meet business requirements - perform functional system testing, and handle User Acceptance testing securing sign-off. Deliver training and create training materials as needed This Role May Be For You If You Drive ongoing improvements to the Workday platform and stay abreast of new improvements to the system modules Drive solution delivery in conjunction with the Managed Service Provider and internal IT team. Ensure integrity and organizational alignment of data structures. Write and analyze reports, review system audit reports and make recommendations on process or technical change. Participate actively in the Workday Community and serve as a Workday advocate within the organization Possess superb communication skills (both written and verbal) with an ability to influence colleagues (within HR and cross-functionally) Have phenomenal Customer Service skills, project a positive attitude, and display professionally mature behavior in meaningful situations Ability to maintain confidentiality and discretion in business relationships and exercise sound business judgment. Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment Understand the importance of change management to facilitate the transition to new technology and processes Ability to work interdependent or as part of a team and to manage work performed by an outsourced vendor both on and offshore Maintain collaborative relationships with internal & external partners Follow Change Management Processes To be considered for this role you must possess a bachelor’s (or master’s) degree in Human Resources, Information Technology, computer sciences, or related fields with 5+ years of advanced experience in Workday Recruitment / Talent modules. Strong knowledge and experience with HRIS systems, project management skills and a track record of holding yourself and others accountable to meet deadlines and achieve business goals. ServiceNow or similar ticketing system experience preferred with Workday Pro Recruiting (strongly preferred) Does this sound like you?
